column4: Really not impressed with the pulled pork roll in the Sainsbury s cafe at Talbot Heath today. It cost over Â£5 and was rather small with a really cheap quality roll that fell apart and not much meat. It was over filled with a glurpy sauce. I was not impressed  surely the quality of the bread roll should be good not a nothing little roll that just falls apart ?  Also the main part of the meal was the chips and the coleslaw when I wanted it to be the roll with chips and slaw on the side. Staff were not at all bothered when I handed it back. All they could say was that the roll had been cooked on the premises which to my mind actually makes it worse.
column9: They did, but it was the poor quality that worried me. Why should the food in your cafe  be not as good as what you sell in your shop ? Especially a thing like a bread roll.  The time before I had a jacket spud with what was stated as butter on the menu in it and it came out with some kind of margarine and butter mix from a tub which I could taste right away. I shall give up ordering food in the cafe.

column9: They sent me a word search puzzle book, which might be good if I was 8 years old but they did it twice, which isnt funny when a neurologist just told me I have a brain glitch..... the voucher that they emailed to me swallows bus fare and leaves me with Â£1 and they emailed me to say they are refunding the product I ordered, instead of the kids puzzle book I returned, like I had a lobotomy. Such bad taste I have rarely encountered and I used to supervise a group of adults with learning difficulties to pick orders for vulnerable people and I can assure you, they did not make as many errors as sainsury have with mine and, thats assuming that sainsbury employ staff with learning difficulties to do more than collect baskets and trolleys. I think they should employ more because the people I worked with were extremely diligent.

column4: Would like to pass on my thanks and appreciation to Julie (Manager) at Team Valley store  for resolving my complaint. Julie s help and professionalism was much appreciated. The ladies at customer service were very helpful and friendly too. Despite days of orders being cancelled my son finally has his Fitbit and is thrilled.A massive thank you to you allx
column9: I made my first order on line, a fit bit for my sons 11th birthday. I ordered Fitbit on line and order was cancelled an hour before collection. My son was really disappointed. I was advised by the store to ring around and if there was one in store they could hold it for me, then could click and collect to get the online discount, which I did. I found one available at team valley (20 miles from where I live) so i reserved it, then set off to get it today. My son was really excited. We arrived at click and collect and were advised that the item wasn't available, nobody had rang to advise us. The man on the van stated that they were aware early on that morning it wasn't there, and someone was meant to call me, they hadn't. The advise given from the first store gave assurances that this wouldn't happen again.  My son was in tears and really upset. I was annoyed that this had happened twice,and nobody had rang out of courtesy. I went into the team Valley store and Julie (I hope this was her name), was lovely, she could see how upset my son was and resolved the matter. It meant I did need to pay  Â£80 for the Fitbit, but the Â£15 discount I would have got was put onto a gift card. She was professional, kind and efficient - as were the other two ladies serving at customer services. Admittedly,I won't be tempted to make another online order with Sainsbury's, however, I am really pleased that my son got his birthday gift, thanks to Julie and her team xx

column4: Sainsbury s - you must think your customers are stupid - I have noticed the 15% price increases on numersous grocery favorites. You bleet on about Living Well for Less....thats not true is it!!!! Sainsbury s you are underhand!
column9: Kate Tarr  you either don't go shopping very often or you don't pay attention. In retail, especially big supermarkets, prices go up and down all year long. Sales of things are tracked and collated centrally and the info shows them what is selling well and what may be ' sticking'. Prices are adjusted accordingly. Also taken into account are ' manufacturers offers' where a consignment of product is bought in at a cheaper price than usual. The saving to the stores is split between several products to show a saving on a ' sticking' product. Of course when stocks of that special priced product runs out prices of other things do tend to increase. At this point the consumer takes notice, blissfully unaware of the many factors that can alter the price of a product from one week to the next. Sometimes ( as Sainsburys Faiza has said) prices from the manufacturer rise and its not always possible to absorb the increase without increasing the price on the shelves.

column4: To anyone who worked at the Merry Hill branch which the highly paid management at head office decided in their wisdom to close today - thanks for your help over the years.  It was always a much more pleasant experience than Asda.  I don t know everyone s names so will just say thanks to all.  I was coming in today and would have said thank you to anyone I knew but I didn t realise  you closed at 5 today.   I hope you were all treated properly by the highly paid management or you find something else.    To the highly paid management - you ve lost a good customer because I cannot and will not be travelling to Amblecote to the middle of a housing estate on two buses to continue to shop with you.  I think your decision stinks and I hope you received my email (in response to the very condescending mailshot email from the store manager stating there would be full deliveries until the end; in fact there have been massive gaps on some shelves for weeks).  I can send it again if you want to know what this very unhappy ex-customer thinks.  Your loss is Asda s gain.

column4: Dear sainsburys  can I please ask what your policy is with click and collect/delivery product shelf life s? 3 weeks in a row now  I have got family members to do collect my food shop from a click and collect point and my mince beef has had a use by date of 2 days and just to really take the mickey  my mushrooms have only had 24 hours. Whilst this would not normally bother me as I would just take it back to the shop  I am unable to drive due to a broken ankle. It s making me very reluctant to use sainsburys for delivery/click and collect anymore because this isn t a one off.
column9: Hi there, I'm really sorry about that. As the items are picked on the day of collection, dates are dependent on what is available in the store that day. I can appreciate how frustrating this is. Can you PM your order number, as well as the name, postcode and email address on the account? Danny.

column4: I have to say i disappointed not just with you but with tesco and asda as well.  I Have a 2 year old girl but anytime i try to shop for jeans all any of you guys (as well as other mainstream shops) offer is skinny leg. Wearing that style of trousers on a regular basis has been shown to cause health problems so im suprised and dissapointed you dont offer a nice selection of bootcut as well. My daughter has had a few problems so i cant be putting her in such restrictive clothing
column9: Hi Jaclyn,  I'm afraid this is the trend and style we're taking into 2017. Unfortunately loose-fitting jeans are a thing of the past! column4: Really disappointed with the tactics of Sainsburys/Nectar when advertising their bonus 8 000 points achieved when you spend 5xÂ£120 during December. Having spent 3  before Xmas week  I attended Stanway store to collect my Xmas online order  which I was told to collect on Dec 23rd between 6pm-8pm. Rather than attend another day to collect my fresh purchases I did my  big shop  on the same day  total spend Â£308 meaning my total spend for the qualifying period was well over Â£700  only to be told that I don t qualify for the 8 000 points because 2 shops were on the 23rd and in the very small print it informs you   no 2 shops to be carried out on the same day ! I am sure all the store colleagues would love every shopper visiting twice over the last 2 days before Xmas and why would any sane shopper want to queue in the car park and fight the crowds to do 2 shops!  one was bad enough! Really poor effort Sainsburys!
column9: Hi Dean, I'm really sorry you're disappointed! Our terms and conditions are there to allow customers to make an informed decision. I can appreciate that the bonus would have been nice at this time of year though. Could you send over your Nectar card number? I'd like to pop a gesture of goodwill so you can treat yourself to something nice. Cheryl

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  can I ask why you have changed your breakfast Wheat Biscuits to the new flavoured round ones? They are taste so different from the old  weetabix  styled ones that my children won t eat them and now we have to buy Weetabix at a higher cost. I too have tried the new ones and agree with the Children  they do taste  funny .... An odd change to make I think ?
column9: Thank you for your response, the shape answer is a bit odd, the old ones fitted just fine into a bowl, and so do weetabix, anyway shape isn't the issue, its the taste. If you changed the taste in any way, perhaps the packaging should have reflected this 'news', Change for Changes sake, this breakfast cereal was always still better than Coco pops or similar products? I could think of a mountain of other products that need your help for healthiness, but not this one.  My only hope is that these are not made by Weetabix and they decide to do the same thing without notice. I will PM my nector details. Thanks for the prompt response anyway.

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  can I ask why you have changed your breakfast Wheat Biscuits to the new flavoured round ones? They are taste so different from the old  weetabix  styled ones that my children won t eat them and now we have to buy Weetabix at a higher cost. I too have tried the new ones and agree with the Children  they do taste  funny .... An odd change to make I think ?
column9: Hey Peter, we recently changed the shape of this product so that it's round instead of a lozenge shape to help us bring a much better retail price to customers and make sure it would fit in a standard breakfast bowl. We've also reduced the salt and sugar in the product to help promote healthy eating. I'm sorry your kids are not fans! If you PM us your Nectar card number I'd be happy to arrange a refund for you. Thanks, Sam.

column4: Sainsburys Brentwood im absolutely appalled by the service I received this evening.  The opening times are incorrect for a second day in a row on your website. I called the store to get some assistance they were extremely rude and hung up on me. The person On the phone made no attempt to tell me who I can contact regarding this or make a complaint to. column4: I took the plunge and decided to try a food shop online.  Order placed   time slot selected and fingers crossed.  The van arrived at the allocated time   a very pleasant helpful guy brought my shopping into my kitchen.   10/10 Sainsburys.  Nothing missing   all fresh goods great 2 substitutes but perfect.    Highly recommend this service and will definitely use again.  At this busy time of year thanks for taking the strain out of a weekly shop.   Look forward to 2017 and more online shopping.
column9: That's fantastic Elizabeth. Happy New Year to you and yours when it comes! Cheryl

column4: Wanted to say a big thank you to your staff in the Wakefield Trinity Walk store who looked after my Mum yesterday when she was taken ill in the store. I was still at the checkout when Mum was sat waiting and felt like she was going to pass out and so laid on the floor so she didn t fall. Staff immediately came to her assistance  as did volunteer community first responder (Bob) who was doing his shopping and spotted what was happening. All the staff involved took great care of Mum  apologies I can t remember all their names but Jeanette was the main lady with us. They fetched her tissues and wipes and a bowl in case she was sick (which she was) and even cleaned it and gave it to us for the car in case it was required on the journey to a&e  as there was a 4 hour wait for an ambulance! Luckily it was nothing serious and Mum is resting at home. Thank you again to all for their help  it was very much appreciated.
column9: Hi Cheryl. Thanks for replying. Mum is fine thankfully. An infection and a temperature   and she is prone to passing out with things like that unfortunately, although thankfully she didn't yesterday or would've been scarier still. It was just after 4pm when it happened and was around 4.40 by the time they wheeled her out to my car, so they looked after us for quite a while. I also had my 12 year old son with me and they were checking he was ok too (it was at the hospital when it hit him and he got upset).  They did take Mum's details to put in an accident book or something at customer services. Mum's name is Julia Griffiths and she has already said she'd like to go in and thank them when she's feeling up to it but it would be nice if you could pass on our thanks in the meantime. It was definitely fabulous service.

column4: Hi Had a delivery from the Stoke on Trent store today 29th December.My daughter ordered ten chickens(sale items) and various small items delivery 3.00 and bags 0.40p.The bulk of the order was based on the chickens so we had the delivery.The delivery arrived and no chickens.My question  would it be common courtesy by Sainsburys to text people telling them the bulk of the order was out of stock.And another point how is the stock controlled.Do your computers for items numerically reduce the stock telling you what you have and have not?.It seems that if youve ordered on line a notice should come up  advising the item is out of stock.This is my daughters first order and we have paid for delivery for items i could of walked to the corner shop for.Do other supermarkets control there ordered stock in this way and considering the profits would it not be an idea to text customers of out of stock items bought in bulk at the rate of a text?
column9: Hi Rob, I'm really sorry about this. Unfortunately with all online deliveries, stock is subject to availability and as the items are picked on the day of delivery, we're unable to guarantee what stock will be available in the store when the items are picked. Can you PM the order number, as well as the name, postcode and email address on the online account please? Danny.

column4: Normally the customer service in your stores is fine and if it isn t I m not particularly inclined to feedback however I think I need to following today.   A cashier at the Colton store in Leeds sat and watched me struggle to bag my shopping whilst I was trying to hold my poorly baby. I was trying to get a kettle into a bag that was in fact sealed and therefore wouldn t open. After watching me struggle for a few minutes i asked her to cut the tag from the bag so I could open it. She was looking at me with utter disdain. She didn t speak to me throughout the whole transaction other than to tell me the price and ask for my nectar card.  I don t expect anyone to pack my shopping for me but I don t think it s unreasonable to offer to help if someone is struggling  at the very least not looking at me like I m a massive pain and inconvenience to her would have been nice  she was beyond rude.
column9: Hi Emma! I'm really sorry about the service you received! Do you recall the colleagues name? What time did this happen at? I'll get this logged with the store's management team. Dee

column4: I m really fed up of feeling bullied by your delivery drivers..i have always tried to be flexible and let them deliver early if they ask to  but i have asked them several times not to come early if i don t answer the phone but they still turn up and ring the bell repeatedly even though they leave messages asking us to ring them back if an early delivery is convenient. People don t just pick random delivery times because they don t really care when it turns up  i pick times which fit in with my day...i have severe health problems and have to fit things around dealing with that. If i don t answer my phone it is because i am either out or am unable to. Today i was out walking my dog  just for ten minutes  but i came back to find that your driver was in such a hurry to knock off early that after getting no answer on the phone he then turned up on our doorstep and rang the bell three times...it is a very loud bell and even the hardest of hearing can hear from outside that it has worked...but he succeeded in waking up my partner who was asleep after working a night shift  who then thinking it was something urgent pulled on his clothes only to find yet again that it was just the sainsbury s delivery man trying to deliver 90 minutes before my chosen delivery time...obviously he accepted the delivery. This is really not acceptable though  and after being a customer of yours for many years i am now so annoyed by this that i really don t know if i should use you again...some of your drivers are lovely  polite and grateful when i accept an early delivery but others are  abrupt and quite clearly just in a rush to get to go home for lunch or finish their shift early  having no respect at all. Claire De Marinis   Shoreham-By-Sea.
column9: I'm really sorry Claire, can you DM your order number & account holder's name please? Steven

column9: I am fortunate that I don't have to rely on home deliveries. I have only ever had two from Sainsbury's (Tesco one and never again) but the second was booked a slot before I was due to do a late turn. Half an hour after the one hour delivery slot had passed I had a phone call from Sainsbury's to say that my delivery would be along "soon"; the cause being that the drivers had walked off the job. I told them not to bother and to refund my bill which took a reminder phone call and an email and received the refund ten days later.

column4: I m really fed up of feeling bullied by your delivery drivers..i have always tried to be flexible and let them deliver early if they ask to  but i have asked them several times not to come early if i don t answer the phone but they still turn up and ring the bell repeatedly even though they leave messages asking us to ring them back if an early delivery is convenient. People don t just pick random delivery times because they don t really care when it turns up  i pick times which fit in with my day...i have severe health problems and have to fit things around dealing with that. If i don t answer my phone it is because i am either out or am unable to. Today i was out walking my dog  just for ten minutes  but i came back to find that your driver was in such a hurry to knock off early that after getting no answer on the phone he then turned up on our doorstep and rang the bell three times...it is a very loud bell and even the hardest of hearing can hear from outside that it has worked...but he succeeded in waking up my partner who was asleep after working a night shift  who then thinking it was something urgent pulled on his clothes only to find yet again that it was just the sainsbury s delivery man trying to deliver 90 minutes before my chosen delivery time...obviously he accepted the delivery. This is really not acceptable though  and after being a customer of yours for many years i am now so annoyed by this that i really don t know if i should use you again...some of your drivers are lovely  polite and grateful when i accept an early delivery but others are  abrupt and quite clearly just in a rush to get to go home for lunch or finish their shift early  having no respect at all. Claire De Marinis   Shoreham-By-Sea.
column9: I totally understand....but even if people are not ill the fact is that they've booked a certain slot because that's when they need it delivered! Poor Rich getting woken up after his night shift is a prime example! If they were knocking on my door at a time when I was asleep then they'd be getting a message like this too! x

column9: Not really to be honest, i had assumed that myself but when questioned the drivers have just fobbed me off and said ""oh i'll make a note on your account that we mustn't knock if you haven't answered the phone"" as if i am being awkward! ...and then it still happens anyway...yesterday was the last straw as i had booked a specific time so that my partner would not get woken up, and i would have time however ill i was to get our dog out for ten minutes before they were even likely ro ring. My partner even asked the driver yesterday why he had come when he had not received an answer on the phone and was told ""oh well people often say they didn't get the call or they thought it was a wrong number, so we just come and try the door anyway"" that was when my partner told him that i was out and had booked the slot purposely, and that he had been working nights. It now sounds like we are being fed a pack of lies from your drivers.

Today i was out walking my dog  just for ten minutes  but i came back to find that your driver was in such a hurry to knock off early that after getting no answer on the phone he then turned up on our doorstep and rang the bell three times...it is a very loud bell and even the hardest of hearing can hear from outside that it has worked...but he succeeded in waking up my partner who was asleep after working a night shift  who then thinking it was something urgent pulled on his clothes only to find yet again that it was just the sainsbury s delivery man trying to deliver 90 minutes before my chosen delivery time...obviously he accepted the delivery. This is really not acceptable though  and after being a customer of yours for many years i am now so annoyed by this that i really don t know if i should use you again...some of your drivers are lovely  polite and grateful when i accept an early delivery but others are  abrupt and quite clearly just in a rush to get to go home for lunch or finish their shift early  having no respect at all. Claire De Marinis   Shoreham-By-Sea.
column9: Try Ocado, they're no more expensive than Sainsbury's and are far better quality and their products have much better shelf life. What's more, their delivery service is much better!

column4: Dear Sainsburys   Can I just say that even though it s a bit annoying how you don t have contactless payments (who even knows their pin these days?) I really appreciate how you have upped your game and provided superior grocery bags since the whole 5p thing.  Recently I completed the 4 day  W trek  in Patagonia  with just a sturdy Sainsburys bag for my food  water and book. Despite horrendous winds  many a prickly bush  and November-in-Glasgow levels of rain  this trooper kept my stuff reliably dry for almost the entire journey. Sadly  less than an hour before ascending to Torres del Paine  my brave Sherpa/soldier/companion was cruelly impaled by a branch and said goodbye to this world.   Thank you for providing such good bags Sainsburys  I will continue buying my blueberries from you.   Kind regards   Brian Donal McCarthy
column9: Here's one of us on day 1: dry, happy and ready for our adventure

column4: This evening I called in at the Swansea branch on Oystermouth Rd. As I was about to leave the store a customer service representative approached me and asked if  I wanted any of the  reduced priced  food   FREE TO A GOOD HOME!  I was really astonished by this kind gesture and generosity. True sign of humanity... Many other customers were also in an orderly manner helping themselves to perfectly good food which would have gone to waste otherwise. I helped myself to some veg and bread. We enjoyed a delicious home cooked soup with bread! Thank you Sainsbury s. Well done. More shops should do this  especially at this time of year when there are homeless people genuinely in need!
column9: Hey Fiona, that's fantastic! Could you confirm the store from here please? http://bit.ly/21oWP3I. I'll ensure your comments are passed on to the Store Manager. Thanks, Sam.

column4: You got this wrong to your store Guinness World Record 2017 online Â£5.99 and in store 8.99 as when I looked at books online from ASDA that what they give the some in store Â£4.00 Girl on the train and that the right from they on your site you got it wrong
column9: We're committed to offering competitive prices for our customers and normally, you'll pay the same price for groceries in store as you would online. As we don't offer same day delivery for grocery products, our online grocery website displays prices for the following day, which would be the first available delivery date. This means that some promotions show on our website a day earlier than they would in store. Steven

column4: I was in your Ballymena store this afternoon with my son Aaron looking for an Xbox One Game which was out of stock in all the Toy and Game stores elsewhere in Ballymena. Your Staff member Adam on the customer service desk checked the computer but it wasn t showing available but he went into the warehouse to check. Your Staff member Adam on the customer service desk checked the computer but it wasn t showing available but he went into the warehouse to check.   When he came back with the game my son was ecstatic.  Can I say thank you to Adam for his help today and he is a credit to your store.
column9: I have always found the staff in Sainsburys to be most helpful, must be their training or just good choice of staff, happy new year to you all.

column4: A jersey was bought from Sainsbury s as a Christmas present  on opening the present on Christmas day  a flaw was noticed  first opportunity to exchange was today    Went to Customer Service and were advised that we could exchange and guess what  not a similar jersey of the correct size was available plenty of the smaller size  mind you.  As you do not have the receipt  we can offer you a gift voucher to spend in the store   that is okay we replied.  Oh! it s been reduced by 50% so you can only have half of what you paid for it  but they are still marked at the original price we pointed out  we haven t got around to changing it yet  but the tills will ring up the correct price.   Thought we would go to another branch and they  also had no stock.   We are regular customers and buy  groceries there evey week so we are no strangers  to the store and yet policy being  policy we are  left with faulty goods and a feeling untrustworthiness  Yep!Truly makes us feel a valued customer. Thanks Guys.

column4: Disappointed with Sainsbury s customer service  after years of online shopping and encouraging others down this route  I now discover that they have changed their policy and will only flag items whose use by dates are the same day as your (it used to be 3 days minimum). Not good if you are doing a weekly shop and trying to meal plan. Also what do you do if you schedule your delivery for a time slot after the kids bedtime for ease?
column9: Hi Rachel, this has always been our short life policy. Any items which expire the same day as your delivery will be pointed out by the driver, or in a blue bag if you receive bagged deliveries. Where were you told this recently changed? Ryan.

column4: Disappointed with Sainsbury s customer service  after years of online shopping and encouraging others down this route  I now discover that they have changed their policy and will only flag items whose use by dates are the same day as your (it used to be 3 days minimum). Not good if you are doing a weekly shop and trying to meal plan. Also what do you do if you schedule your delivery for a time slot after the kids bedtime for ease?
column9: In the many years that I have been online shopping with you I have had a blue bag for short life items and not just same day expiration and when this hasn't been flagged you've always been nice enough to refund the error. These weren't flagged recently for a 730-830 scheduled delivery giving me just over 24 hours to consume said items that were clearly part of a delivery for Christmas dinner. I did discover Yesterday that Tesco have a different policy to yourselves though.

column4: Disappointed with Sainsbury s customer service  after years of online shopping and encouraging others down this route  I now discover that they have changed their policy and will only flag items whose use by dates are the same day as your (it used to be 3 days minimum). Not good if you are doing a weekly shop and trying to meal plan. Also what do you do if you schedule your delivery for a time slot after the kids bedtime for ease?
column9: Hi Rachel, we class items as short life when they expire the same day as your delivery. Anything with a longer expiration date than this is not considered a short life item. Consumer rights do apply to goods purchased online, however I am not in a position to confirm/advise whether this applies to perishable goods which have a finite life cycle opposed to goods which serve a specific purpose or length of service. It's possible that your fulfilment store has been including items with longer life with the short life items, however the policy itself has not changed.   If you PM me your order number, account holder's name, telephone number and e-mail along with the items which were affected, I'll be happy to get something sorted for you. Ryan.

column4: Just went to your  store in Abbey Wood  to return a chocolate ice lolly which had a large shard of wood attached to it chocolate coating.  The young lady on customer services was brilliant and she called for a manager so it could be investigated.  This was a waste of time  as the so called manager was not in the least bit concerned that someone had hurt them selves on this item.   I was informed if I wanted this to be investigated I had to call the number on the packet and it was not for the store to do this or inform other customers to be careful if they had purchased these items  as it was to remote a possibility for them to be concerned with this incident to happen to anyone else.   I am disgusted with the attitude of your management team a customer got hurt here is a tenner as a good will gesture now go away whilst we throw this item in the bin and forget about it.  I told him to keep the tenner and refund and I would be taking this further  it is the responsibility of you company to concern it self when a customer gets hurt due to a product you sell  it is your responsibility to ensure that all products are fit for purpose  its not for the customer to run around ensuring other customers do not get hurt whilst purchasing products brought in your store which were manufactured on Sainsbury behalf..  I do expect Salisbury to inform customers of the possibility of wood in your ice creams lolly s even if this bits into your profits.
column9: It appears Sainsburys really don't care about their customers.

column9: L6294SS 09.50 OCT 2018 PACK of 4 Almond chocolate lollies.  Its not the money or refund policy, it is the fact this Asian manager did not take this seriously.  It was obvious even to the young black customer service girl who was concerned, that a lolly stick had split into many pieces and entered the food chain.  A child could easy choke the wooden shard was large enough for that to happen, he didn't even suggest  putting a notice up or checking other stock, it was just pure profit and covering sainsbury back.   It was dismissed as its just one of those things, he just didn't want to know -  didn't care about the harm caused to my partner or any other person who could have purchased this item.  It was up to me to follow this through and phone the number on the packet.  I did not notice what his name was but he came from the managers office and it was  afternoon, I also returned a pair of men trousers at the same time as bring this to customer service's attention.

column4: Absolutely disgusted with Sainsbury s local in Loughton. We went in with my three year old this morning and as a treat we went to buy her a little gingerbread man. We went to the self service til and it wouldn t go through. After 5 minutes of the sales assistant saying she would be there  in a minute  she came over and muttered something and walked away. Another member of staff then came over and said  I can t sell you this  and practically snatched the biscuit out of my little girls hand. She burst into tears and he just walked off! He could clearly hear her but didn t care and didn t give us any explanation!  Such rude service! Will not be going back any time soon!
column9: If it dont scan u cant sell? What the hell?!

column9: Hi Sarah, this is correct. If the item doesn't scan on our systems we can't sell it. Sometimes we'll be able to utilise reduction sticker barcodes to allow these to scan but generally that will only apply to products where the barcode itself is at fault. Ryan.

Another member of staff then came over and said  I can t sell you this  and practically snatched the biscuit out of my little girls hand. She burst into tears and he just walked off! He could clearly hear her but didn t care and didn t give us any explanation!  Such rude service! Will not be going back any time soon!
column9: Hi Gemma, really sorry about this. Unfortunately if an item doesn't scan, we can't sell it and this should have been explained to you. I'd like to make sure we feed back your experience to the store manager to ensure that our colleagues are taking the time to explain this in a courteous manner. Would this be the local on Church Hill that you visited? Can you give me a name or description of the colleague please? Ryan.

column4: How do you check an item is in stock on online shopping
column9: Hi Clement, if you're logged in and can see the item, it's in stock. Certain items such as large electricals aren't available online. Please be advised however, all orders are subject to stock availability on the day your order is picked, not the day you place your order. Ryan.

column4: Hi Sainsbury s  I bought a pack fresh chicken drumsticks at Woolwich store on Friday 23rd Dec I checked dates obviously because I wanted to use them today for a family buffet and to my disgust on Christmas Day evening when wanting to prepare them in a marinade overnight for today the smell was horrendous and the chicken had green patches on them the date on these was 27th Dec if I was well enough would of taken back to store to exchange or money back but sadly I couldn t make the trip due to mobility issues and being an OAP!!!! I expected more from Sainsbury s to be quite honest in regards to freshness!!!

column9: The problem with supermarkets is the lack of trained staff who handle raw meat products ( no disrespect to anyone on here, you are only doing your job ), they can only go by use by dates and unless it has been kept in perfect conditions the 'going off process' can start before it even goes on the shelf, ive been in supermarkets a few times now and noticed less than healthy meat products on the shelf which ive handed in to customer services. And Tamara I'm so sorry to hear about your dad, such a lovely chap, life is so cruel sometimes.

column9: I have to agree with Steve Covell it depends how strict the supermarket is with the meat, I also think that it is down to tamaras neighbour who saved her christmas lunch with the chicken bits... what I would like to say is if the chicken had been eaten we wouldn't be looking at wether or not it was a satisfactory just to give a refund it would be referred to environmental health with a very poorly family and young children which would then in tail fines and investigations into sainsburys processes and the management of their raw meat products I appreciate everyone is entitled to their opinions but I beleive sainsburys needs to take more responsibility and if it was me and this is my opinion I would have massively kicked off and I wouldn't settle for 9.60. Raw meat and samonella is a very serious thing!

column4: We were at Sainsbury s earlier doing a pre Christmas shop. I put all the groceries into our collapsible Colruyt box. The cashier was impressed with the box. I proudly credited the Belgian supermarket chain. I then picked up the box and the bottom fell out....A bottle of pomegranate and elderflower presse hit the floor with a bang and pink spray!!!! Kudos for the speed with which Sainbury s staff cleared up the mess AND replaced the bottle and rather soggy loaf of bread!!!
column9: Oh no Neil, what a nightmare I'm so glad our colleagues were able to hep you out and replace the items! Which store was this? Did you catch the name of the colleagues that helped out? Maria

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  What on earth is going on with your food delivery service? I bought into the hype of booking a Christmas delivery slot (3 weeks in advance). One of the items (the main one give it was a Christmas food shop)  was a 3kg UNBASTED turkey Crown. You sent a 6kg BASTED turkey crown. Basted with BUTTER. Not a very clever substitution given that the rest of the shop contained 20 items worth Â£22.90 of specifically non-dairy (soya based) items. Indicating  one would have thought  that there was at least one person in the household with a dairy intolerance. Luckily a local butcher managed to provide what Sainsbury s couldn t  even though you had 3 weeks notice. Then imagine my  delight  when preparing the veggies for Christmas dinner yesterday to find most of the vegetables delivered by you had use by dates varying from 22nd December to the 24th December. Shame on you Sainsbury s.
column9: Online shopping is only picked on the day of delivery.

column4: Hello sainsburys. I just wanted to say a massive thank you for some brilliant customer service I received at your Wadsley Bridge store in Sheffield. I went into your store yesterday in the hope of buying a nut free christmas fruit cake (a new cake I know you ve been selling this year). Unfortunately it was out of stock. I went to find a staff member and he told me that you wouldn t be getting any more stock in now. But he offered me a solution. He said he d call up another shop in the city and see if they had any stock in. Thankfully they did. But he didn t stop there. He then offered to go and speak to a manager who passes by the other store and see if they could pick up this cake for me and bring it to my local store for today. The manager said yes it was no problem. What a lovely thing to do. The staff member who helped me was called Jack and I d love for him to know how grateful I was for such brilliant customer service. Unfortunately I didn t get the managers name but thank you to them too! Absolutely wonderful customer service for an allergy family who can t just buy any regular cake and given the fact that I had left it so late to get one it was entirely my own fault. So please let Jack know what a wonderful job he is doing. Thank you. Liisa
column9: That's great to hear Liisa, when did you visit the store? I'll get this logged with the store management. Steven

column4: Hello sainsburys. I just wanted to say a massive thank you for some brilliant customer service I received at your Wadsley Bridge store in Sheffield. I went into your store yesterday in the hope of buying a nut free christmas fruit cake (a new cake I know you ve been selling this year). Unfortunately it was out of stock. I went to find a staff member and he told me that you wouldn t be getting any more stock in now. But he offered me a solution. He said he d call up another shop in the city and see if they had any stock in. Thankfully they did. But he didn t stop there. He then offered to go and speak to a manager who passes by the other store and see if they could pick up this cake for me and bring it to my local store for today. The manager said yes it was no problem. What a lovely thing to do. The staff member who helped me was called Jack and I d love for him to know how grateful I was for such brilliant customer service. Unfortunately I didn t get the managers name but thank you to them too! Absolutely wonderful customer service for an allergy family who can t just buy any regular cake and given the fact that I had left it so late to get one it was entirely my own fault. So please let Jack know what a wonderful job he is doing. Thank you. Liisa
column9: Thank you x

column4: Just wanted to wish all your shopping pickers a very Merry Christmas. I received my order Thursday night  and everything I asked for was there. column4: Why do I go into your store in fallowfield Manchester  and find you find raising money for Great Ormond Street children s hospital  not or own Royal Manchester Children s Hospital. column4: Dear sainsburys.. Come a little closer.. I d like to talk to you about community spirit. Today I went to purchase a Christmas bouquet to decorate my home with in my favourite little local store  I looked at the pretty bouquets and lots of them there were too. But all had expiry of today  so in honesty didn t purchase one. I got chatting to one of your store colleagues and through that conversation he told me that boquets have to be thrown away if they are not sold on the day of display until. They cannot reduce them for the public to buy. Now   seriously.  You throw them away? What about giving them to local elderly homes or people that are sick within the community or maybe even to a customer who looks like they ve had a particularly crap day? So much is wasted in our world already  why don t you turn that waste into cheer? Just an idea.... But a bloody good one if I do say so myself. Merry Christmas Sainsburys ðŸŽ„
column9: Hiya. I don't know the guys name. It was Albert Road in Southsea

column4: We have just visited your chichester store and wanted to pass on our thanks to a cashier called Alexander. When our 4year old spotted him today she stopped in her tracks in awe as she was adamant he was Father Christmas  instead of shattering the magical moment and telling her he just looked like the Santa  he got straight into character and stayed in character for the entire time whilst he put our shopping through. Our daughter is over the moon to have seen Father Christmas today with it being Christmas Eve. Alexander is a credit to your chichester store as he must of had that scenario a lot this month and we felt he deserved some recognition. Merry Christmas Alexander and merry Christmas Sainsbury s! From the Lee family.

column4: Yesterday morning (Friday 23rd December at 8:30am) I popped into Tesco Tower Park  I only needed one thing & it was my nearest supermarket at the time. As expected it was manic! Sadly  shoppers were rushing  being rude  I even heard a boy no older than 6 apologise to a staff member because his dad was so rude to her! The staff weren t rude or unpleasant but there wasn t a very festive feel! To be honest  I m not surprised due to the way some of the shoppers were behaving! This morning (Christmas Eve at 8:15am) I popped to Sainsburys Alder Hills  which is my usual supermarket. I needed a few last minute bits & to collect my Christmas food order. It too was very busy BUT everyone (staff & shoppers) was calm and happy. People were stopping to say hello & chat & some were even browsing  just taking their time. The staff that served me were nothing but lovely! It s the simplest of things and my trip to Sainsburys this morning really has put me in such a festive mood! Thank you Sainsburys Alder Hills for showing that this really can be the most wonderful time of the year! Merry Christmas to you all!

column9: I am afraid that food laws being what they are, you absolutely cannot eat food past it's use by dates. Ask any enviromental health inspector. It is your risk BUT at the end of the day, people have been affected by nasty contaminants in food that has gone past its use by. Do not confuse use by with best before. Best before means that you can eat it after that date, but the quality will not be as high. Use by means that: use by. I completely agree with Fliss. I would NEVER eat food that had gone past it's use by date. But it is a risk that many would take.

Over Â£100 spent  and half of it no good to me.  A huge waste of money.  Please can someone from Customer Services contact me to discuss further?
column9: Gosh. I must be pretty strange, since sell by and best by dates mean nothing to me. I have looked upon them as a rather cynical ploy by stores to prompt me to throw away perfectly good food, and buy more. I just store everything safely, and use my own judgement as to whether something is safe to eat. Which thankfully has never let me down. Maybe coming from a third world country has something to do with it?

column4: Quick question...........Can you please explain to me why when I went to order two items from your food to order book I was told they were out of stock and ordered alternatives that there were plenty of both items for sale off the shelf in my local store tonight...........It has put me off using your pre ordering service in the future.............
column9: Hi Karen, really sorry about this. You may have seen some of those items available because we still allocate some stock to be sold on the shop floor for customers who'd prefer to just pop in and take a chance at what we have available.   Our Christmas Food to Order (CTFO) service is to help guarantee you get the items you want for your Christmas day dinner (but there are some options exclusive to our collection menu). My apologies for the dates on the goods, we do try to choose the best dates possible however the collection service is intended for customers who are purchasing food for Christmas day and as such we ensure the product life will meet that intended requirement. Ryan.

column4: Quick question...........Can you please explain to me why when I went to order two items from your food to order book I was told they were out of stock and ordered alternatives that there were plenty of both items for sale off the shelf in my local store tonight...........It has put me off using your pre ordering service in the future.............
column9: Further to this I have collected my pre order this morning as arranged to find all three items have an expiry date of 26 December and one of them cannot be frozen which is what we planned to do with it........................I am absolutely furious about this............Please can something be done about this as it is totally unacceptable.....................as in my previous comment I will not be using pre order again

column4: Had a great wee afternoon in the Irvine sainsburys store today   while the rest of the town was reportedly in chaos with Christmas shoppers.  Went in with a very long list and managed to get every single item and some little lovely extras with the help of some very festive n cheerful staff   my trolley was bulging and i became a wee bit flustered at the checkout . I was assisted by a diamond of a lady named Debbie   who helped me .I had a great wee chat with her and she helped me pack my bags .I was telling her what a stress free shop I had and lovely the staff were . To my surprise she then    Gave me a beautiful bunch of flowers and wished me a happy Christmas . Thank you Debbie and sainsburys Irvine . Full of Christmas spirit . I left the store feeling very festive indeed â¤ï¸ðŸŽ„ðŸŽ…ðŸ¼

I was assisted by a diamond of a lady named Debbie   who helped me .I had a great wee chat with her and she helped me pack my bags .I was telling her what a stress free shop I had and lovely the staff were . To my surprise she then    Gave me a beautiful bunch of flowers and wished me a happy Christmas . Thank you Debbie and sainsburys Irvine . Full of Christmas spirit . I left the store feeling very festive indeed â¤ï¸ðŸŽ„ðŸŽ…ðŸ¼

column4: I was in the Silksworth  Sunderland store at 3pm today and all of the Christmas stuff was being taken away! Is that some kind of joke? It s not past Christmas. What about people who have last minute things to do because it s the only chance they have?  I d understand if it was 3pm on the 24th but not the 23rd! You spend all that time and money on the BIG rival Christmas advert but you re not really about Christmas! I m disappointed!
column9: Sorry Amanda, what time did you visit the store? I'll get this logged with the store management for internal review. Steven

column4: Dear Sainsbury s    I have never been so disappointed  cross or upset as I am right now. I ordered and paid for my Christmas food shop weeks ago  it s turned up and the Pork and Turkey is missing  I asked for no substitutes as I wanted to underline that I want my item and I don t want you to decide what I eat. Could you explain what the point is of running a service that can t keep up with its demands. I m 5 months pregnant  my husband is away for work  I have twins in bed ....and now no Christmas dinner! What exactly am I meant to do?  How can I go to the shops this evening? What if there isn t any pork and Turkey in the shops tomorrow.  I m shocked that shopping with you is basically a Russian roulette as to who comes first .... it s an outrage.  Thank you for not helping in the slightest  but for adding more worry to already stressful week.   Please could you let me know how you plan to rectify or save my Christmas dinner!  From    A disappointed  more stressed out than necessary  concerned  fretting mother!   Pippa
column9: Could you confirm you have received it

column9: I'm really sorry about this Pippa, as the order you placed is a normal order and as such is subject to availability on the day your order is picked in store and e outline this in the T&Cs of ordering which you accept by placing the order. We offer a Christmas Food to Order collection service from the 30th of September until the 15th of December for customers who want to place a special order for Christmas and to avoid disappointment if there are availability issues with certain items. I've contacted the store but unfortunately we won' t be able to provide these products today. As a gesture of goodwill, I've sent you a Â£30 gift card which should be with you within five working days. I hope you have a lovely Christmas. Sam.

column4: So sainsbury s can you answer me a question? I have been dutifully using your stores to get my nectar points and have been saving them up all year waiting to do the  big shop  at Christmas  we decided to go to the bigger store in reading rather than the one we usually use as it will have more choices! So after filling our trolley with all sorts of goodness and managing to get straight onto a till we were disappointed to find out that we couldn t use our points as it was not our local store???? Why can I get points from anywhere but limited to where I can spend them? Surely it all goes back to one point? What if I wanted to purchase something that wasn t at our local store? Merry Christmas eh
column9: It's to prevent someone nicking your points if they steal your card.  The staff should have offered to phone Nectar and take you through security.  Nectar then give a workaround.

column4: So sainsbury s can you answer me a question? column4: So sainsbury s can you answer me a question? I have been dutifully using your stores to get my nectar points and have been saving them up all year waiting to do the  big shop  at Christmas  we decided to go to the bigger store in reading rather than the one we usually use as it will have more choices! So after filling our trolley with all sorts of goodness and managing to get straight onto a till we were disappointed to find out that we couldn t use our points as it was not our local store???? Why can I get points from anywhere but limited to where I can spend them? Surely it all goes back to one point? What if I wanted to purchase something that wasn t at our local store? Merry Christmas eh
column9: Hi Mark, sorry for the hassle. Customers are able to redeem points in all our stores. To do this at the checkout, you must have shopped in that store within the last 12 months. If you haven't, our store colleagues are able to perform a Nectar workaround. This involves one of our colleagues calling the Nectar helpline during their opening hours and then passing the phone to you to confirm some security questions. I'm concerned this didn't happen on your visit and you were given the wrong information. Maria

column9: So agree!  I loved my work during the vacations at JS.  People assume you're not capable of, or aspiring to, anything else - let alone that you might enjoy it (I LOVED it and it was the making of me.)  The surprise when I was able to add up - explain I have a Maths A-level - what are you doing here if you've got an A-level in Maths?  - all that sort of behaviour.  I owe an eternal debt to JS for many things, including how to pack a good carrier bag.  Retail is hard work but it has its upsides.

column4: Congratulations to all the staff at Sainsbury s Cannon Park  Coventry.  The store is heaving but the staff are doing a brilliant job  good-humoured and helpful.  Making Christmas that bit easier for all - many thanks!
column9: It's hard work in a big supermarket at Christmas. I worked on the Fosse Park Asda checkout for 6 months including Xmas 1991. I always try to be really nice and friendly to staff working on checkouts now as I know how it feels to be ignored, belittled and even abused. I was once explaining to a young boy who'd asked how the scanner worked. He said I don't think I'd like to work on the checkout, at which point his father piped up, ""I should think not son but some people don't aspire to much!"".  Obviously thought I'd be too thick to understand and take offence!! I have never forgotten his rudeness.

column4: Received my large order this morning   Thank you Sainsburys Romford   brilliant service..brilliant staff. I have used home delivery from you for some years   and find your service superb. Never had a  grumpy  driver   always happy  cheerful and helpful    a pleasure to talk to. Today  had a couple of acceptable subs   well explained  quite happy with them. My shopping was well packed  and unloaded   No short dates   everything had a good lifespan  thank you to my picker  for a great shop   could not have done any better myself.. Happy Christmas to you all   thanks for everything

column4: Help please.  As a loyal sainsburys customer had a stressful visit to the Heyford Hill store in Oxford.  First issue found a turkey breast with stuffing etc for our first Xmas dinner as a family of 4..a bargain at Â£16 only to realise I ve been charged Â£20! Then to top it off...shopping with my 3year old son and 3month old  my eldest who loves your Xmas ad picks up and Dave gingerbread cookie which I said he could have once we d paid for the shopping. When the lady scanned it it said couldn t be sold so took it from us...cue screaming upset 3 year old  then she said oh it s OK and gave it to us. Now slightly concerned that we have just eaten a dodgy item.  Very disappointed Sainsburys.
column9: Hi Michelle, sorry about your in-store experience! Do you have the barcode for the Turkey you purchased so I can check the pricing? Paul

column4: I would like to say i am a very unhappy customer! I went to collect my shopping for christmas ... which i ordered weeks in advance to find that they had substituted my 3 bird roast for a turkey breast! If i wanted turkey breast i would have ordered it. I have now had to seek an alternative turkey as a breast was not suitable. Surely when the order is place there should be an allocation put aside for click and collect orders??? I had to take my 5 month old son around another supermarket (as sainsburys was so busy there were queues everywhere) ... which is why i placed a click and collect order in the first place to avoid this!! I will not be shopping with you again anytime soon!!!
column9: Thank you Ryan i have messaged my details. My main issue is that i was in store two days ago and there was a fridge full of the bird roasts but none in my order! I would have thought there would be an allocation put aside for orders already placed. Emma

column9: Hi Emma, the order you placed is a normal order and as such is subject to availability on the day your order is picked in store and e outline this in the T&Cs of ordering which you accept by placing the order. We offer a Christmas Food to Order collection service from the 30th of September until the 15th of December for customers who want to place a special order for Christmas and to avoid disappointment if there are availability issues with certain items.   If you PM me over your order number along with the account holder's name, address, email and telephone number, I'll see what I can do to make this right for you. Ryan.

column4: Hello sainsburys I just want to give a massive thank you to your Winchester badgers farm sainsburys especially Sue and Ian who work there. Yesterday I went out to my chest freezer which is in my outhouse  sometime between Monday and yesterday morning it had been left open and somehow switched off at the fuse switch everything had defrosted! I was  devastated! Only been shopping a week before and filling it with Christmas food too. My friend Sue saw my fb status and I said I was going up to sainsburys today to replace what I could  when I got there Ian came too me and gave my boys a gift each and Sue had arranged 15% off my shopping and a nectar points booster. This was totally unexpected and appreciated and saved us a fair bit money. So a huge thank you to sainsburys and I really feel christmassy again. The Christmas spirt at its best right there thank you.
column9: What an amazing thing to Sainsbury's badgerfarm big shout out to all the staff involved making this happen xðŸŽðŸŽ„â¤â¤

Until I ve just received an email  the day after the food was delivered  to say the vouchers couldn t be applied and now the total amount is coming out of our bank account. column9: Hayley, this clearly isn't working via social media. This is a complaint and I want you to deal with it as such. If you can't then please escalate to a person or department who can. I do not wish to have more points to spend at Sainsbury's. I tried that already and I'm now out of pocket by Â£100 (including cashed in nectar vouchers I couldn't use online). I want redress. That is for you to put me back in the same position I would have been in had you not made your error. That is Â£75 refunded to my bank account and you can delete the Â£75 of vouchers from my voucher wallet online. And I want some consideration for extra compensation for your error. But more than that, I want someone to explain to me how this can happen. How can you accept vouchers for an order only to change your mind AFTER delivery?? We save hard for Christmas, budget well, to ensure we don't get caught in the debt trap. And a large corporation like yourselves just make life that bit harder. It's not acceptable.

column4: **** never purchase or provide a Sainsbury s gift card to anyone you think anything of***** Admittedly not a regular Sainsbury s shopper but I received a gift card so thought I d nip in and get a few last minute items ... the HASSLE to use the gift card in store was quite literally mind numbing in this day in age ... column4: Sainsbury s as a store has good reviews  but Sainsbury s Energy is one to avoid. Last October  British Gas recommended Sainsburys Energy as a cheaper tariff as my current tariff was due to end. I contacted SE and received a reply on 18 Oct 2016  to say my energy switch to Sainsburys from British Gas would take 2 weeks. At the beginning of Dec I realised I had heard nothing further from SE so I registered a complaint on SE page and was given a complaint ref. number. I also went onto register the same complaint on British Gas website as they had recommended SE to me. I was surprised to see only a few digits difference between the complaints reference numbers of SE and BG. Then I realised BG and SE are one and the same.  Sainsbury s Energy is a trading name used under licence by British Gas Trading Limited  a Centrica company. Registered in England and Wales No. 3078711 I was told by SE that they had no record of me applying to  change   so I sent them a copy of the email I received from SE in October  and I was told it appeared that the request had been ignored. British Gas are not interested in my problem and have just said to contact SE as it is their fault  even though they are one and the same company and even use the same complaints and computer systems. As a result  BG have put me on the highest tariff possible as my tariff with BG has expired. After an initial response from SE on 7 Dec  I have heard NOTHING  so I am still paying their alter ego British Gas at the highest rate. I have contacted OFGEM  to ask why these so called  white label arrangements   which allow bigger companies such as BG to supply energy to companies who don t hold their own supply licence such as Sainsburys  are allowed at all. Why can t BG offer customers the same rate as their alter ego company? There must be some financial benefit in this for BG  but certainly not for the customer when they wash their hands of any problems encountered by customers in the so called   switch .  I continue to pay BG at the highest rate with no communication from BG or SE since Dec 6 2016. Trading Standards really needs to look at the practices of Big Energy Companies and the scams they appear to be pulling on customers.  It s Trading Standards and OFGEM I will deal with now as I have had enough of Big Business attitudes.
column9: I haven't been given a customer reference number, if I had I would have put a review on Reevoo to join the other bad reviews such as this example :  Troubled joining process. Tried switching to them. Thought I had as I received a joining letter welcoming me and a contract. Few weeks later got a bill from my old supplier. Turns out Sainsbury's computer system couldn't find my address and auto rejected me wwithout telling anyone. They apologised and manually enrolled me. It's several weeks later but am now with them. But still sorting out some remaining issues. Very poor experience. Avoid.

column4: I have to say I ordered my Christmas food order online this year for the very first time! Lesson learnt I will never do that again!! What a joke Sainsbury s! No Turkey as apparently you d run out... you clearly were aware that your shelves were bare prior to my delivery  substitute items were a joke which resulted in me having to go back to the store to return all said items  but the highlight for me was the order of 6 pints of milk  you sent 8 and charged me for...wait for it... 48!!!! Yes Â£12 of milk!! I returned to store where a lovely man took the items off me to return to my card once the driver returned later that evening  however it occurs to me that I was only able to return 8 pints of milk and not the other 40 as they weren t delivered  so I m guessing I may need to phone again to get that rectified! I did get a good will voucher gesture In store  however 3 supermarkets later I finally found a turkey!! Well done Sainsbury s I ll never order food online with you again!... I m still waiting for my email to say you have refunded me which still hasn t come through as of yet!
column9: Lesson learnt Alison, I only ordered on line this year because we are going through a stressful time and back and forth the hospital daily with my father in law.  Thought it would be one thing less to worry about. No chance! X

column9: We are really proud that at Christmas we will do a great job of serving our customers wherever and whenever they want us to. This is at the heart of what we are about as a big retailer, particularly at the busiest time of year when our customers rely on us to help them celebrate with everything they need. We also know that this is an important time of year for our colleagues, and we will do everything we can to help them have the time off that they ask for and want to spend with their families. Faiza.

column9: Hi there Adrian, how long have you spotted this as an issue? We'll pass this on to store management. Debs

column4: Having purchased 3 roles of your Merry Christmas Wrap (4m) and matching Merry Christmas tags in one of your 3 for 2 offers  despite being covered in red glitter when wrapping  I was impressed with the quality of the paper and tags.  So you can imagine my delight when I found that you still had some available in store yesterday. Having eagerly purchased another 3 roles and packs of matching tags  I set about wrapping more presents tonight. Only to be disappointed by the quality of the paper and tags - the paper has printing errors (lines of unexplained red glitter) and does not come with a cutting guide on the reverse (as advertised). The matching tags whilst much of a muchness do not come with the string attached (as the first 3 packets I purchased did). Whilst all minor points that are perhaps not even worthy of mentioning  I am disappointed enough to consider it worthy of a post.
column9: Good spot ðŸ˜Š

column4: Thanks for that  Click and collect. Placed an order over a week ago for my christmas shop When I picked it up the bacon lattice turkey breast roast I had ordered had been replaced with a turkey crown with stuffing  at  full 25% more cost. I was told it had been substituted as the item I ordered was sold out days ago. It wasn t sold out when I ordrered it  though. The click and collect van at Upton couldn t credit the cost back to me as I didn t want a turkey crown as I don t want t have to deal with a carcass  so I had to walk into the shop and queue only to be told I had to go back to the van to sort it. I refused and after a short wait it was refunded but then I found that there were NO breast joints available that compared so I ve had to get other meat instead. I was looking forward to that on Christmas day and I m having christmas alone so I thought I could rely on Sainsburys to not screw it up. Cheers

column4: Alot of nectar points i couldnt spend in store becuase it wasnt my  home  store.... what bloody stupid rule and a rule i wasnt aware of ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­
column9: Thanks, We'll be sure to have this passed on to management in store so colleagues are aware of options they can offer customers. The reason we have a home store system is so if your card is lost or stolen, people can't use it elsewhere. You can either speak with Nectar before making your journey to the store, buy something and use your card to earn points, so that's it's recognised on the system, or the colleagues in store can offer the workaround which means our colleague at the customer service desk will call Nectar to have your card activated in the store. Apologies this wasn't explained to you. Please be assured this has been passed on internally. Faiza.

column4: I just wanted to say a huge THANK YOU to Charlotte and Cathy at your Warren Heath Ipswich store yesterday. I stopped in after work to pick up a couple of things  but there wasn t any mobility scooters availability. I am disabled and use a crutch but cannot walk far enough to walk around the store.   When I enquired at the customer services desk if there were any scooters available  Charlotte said they were both in use but she would call over one of their  helping hands  scheme helpers and get them to assist me. Before I know it Cathy was there with a wheelchair and kindly pushed me round whilst I got my shopping.  She was so helpful and passed me items off of the shelves to look at. She even helped me at the till and packed my shopping for me and wheeled me back to customer services.  I cannot thank these ladies enough  they made me feel like no task was too much and went out of their way to help me shop. Plus it meant that I was able to get the rest of my Christmas shopping without having to come back on an even busier day.   I m not sure if I got the name of the scheme correct  so apologies if I have but I just wanted to say what a fantastic idea. It was so nice to for once not feel like an inconvenience because you are disabled and to get the help you need without being rush.   Please pass my thanks on Charlotte and Cathy. Great service which made up for the hour wait to get our of the car park ðŸ˜‰
column9: Thank you Danny :) Merry Christmas!

column4: I just wanted to say a huge THANK YOU to Charlotte and Cathy at your Warren Heath Ipswich store yesterday. I stopped in after work to pick up a couple of things  but there wasn t any mobility scooters availability. I am disabled and use a crutch but cannot walk far enough to walk around the store.   When I enquired at the customer services desk if there were any scooters available  Charlotte said they were both in use but she would call over one of their  helping hands  scheme helpers and get them to assist me. Before I know it Cathy was there with a wheelchair and kindly pushed me round whilst I got my shopping.  She was so helpful and passed me items off of the shelves to look at. She even helped me at the till and packed my shopping for me and wheeled me back to customer services.  I cannot thank these ladies enough  they made me feel like no task was too much and went out of their way to help me shop. Plus it meant that I was able to get the rest of my Christmas shopping without having to come back on an even busier day.   I m not sure if I got the name of the scheme correct  so apologies if I have but I just wanted to say what a fantastic idea. It was so nice to for once not feel like an inconvenience because you are disabled and to get the help you need without being rush.   Please pass my thanks on Charlotte and Cathy. Great service which made up for the hour wait to get our of the car park ðŸ˜‰
column9: That's fantastic to hear Sophie! I've passed your very kind words along to the management team at our Warren Heath store, and they'll ensure the girls get a well deserved pat on the back! Danny.

column4: I would like to make a complaint about a member of you colleagues at kidderminster store. Whilst doing my FAMILY Xmas shopping (spent around Â£100) with husband to be and my daughter the woman behind the til said she would not sell me Xmas crackers! She said I do not look 25 and  explosives are dangerous.  Considering I am 29 and clearly look old enough and safe enough to purchase crackers for my family I found her judgement to be completely wrong. I have worked in retail for around 15 years so please do not explain the think 25 law to me and tell me it is her discretion. I actually think she was taking to mic and spoke in a VERY patronising tone! I do not carry ID around to buy Xmas crackers! So now I want to inform you that I will be having Xmas dinner with my family with no crackers because I live in a rural location and work full time with a young child I do not have time to go back out again for crackers! I wanted to carry out my big Xmas shop in one trip! Sadly I did not get the ladies name but perhaps you need to re-train your staff. I am reluctant to choose Sainsbury s for shopping again!
column9: Hi Tory, sorry that you have had a bad in-store experience! As these items do fall under that category then Think 25 does come into use. I understand were you are coming from and the colleague should have used their discretion and sold them to you. I will be passing this along to the store manager so that they can look at further training on this. Paul

column4: I would like to make a complaint about a member of you colleagues at kidderminster store. Whilst doing my FAMILY Xmas shopping (spent around Â£100) with husband to be and my daughter the woman behind the til said she would not sell me Xmas crackers! She said I do not look 25 and  explosives are dangerous.  Considering I am 29 and clearly look old enough and safe enough to purchase crackers for my family I found her judgement to be completely wrong. I have worked in retail for around 15 years so please do not explain the think 25 law to me and tell me it is her discretion. I actually think she was taking to mic and spoke in a VERY patronising tone! I do not carry ID around to buy Xmas crackers! So now I want to inform you that I will be having Xmas dinner with my family with no crackers because I live in a rural location and work full time with a young child I do not have time to go back out again for crackers! column4: Had the most INCREDIBLE customer service yesterday! :) My online order was missing quite a lot of items  all of them stuff for my Christmas dinner. I called the Customer Care line and spoke to a very helpful  patient agent (annoyingly  I didn t get his name - but he was amazing) who actually took the time to listen to me. He offered to call the store for me and see if there was anything they could do. I figured he d just put me on hold for ages and come back and say nothing could be done. I was stunned when he came back to say he d spoken to someone at the Warrington store and that he had offered to go and check the store for me for all the missing items! He promised me a callback within an hour. Simon Jones at the Warrington store called me back within that time frame and had found almost all the missing things for me! Not only that  but he then found someone to deliver them all (at no extra cost) on their way home! Geoff was the kind driver that brought my Christmas dinner essentials to me at the very end of his shift  when I m sure he d have much preferred to just head straight home. Thank you SO much to all involved for truly outstanding service. All 3 people I dealt with were incredible and deserve recognition. It s so rare nowadays to receive such great service. I still can t quite believe it. It was my first time ordering through Sainsbury s home delivery and  thanks to Simon  Geoff and the guy at Customer Care (might have been Alan?)  I ll definitely be doing it again. Happy Christmas! :)
column9: That's fantastic to hear Emma. When did you make the call? Can you PM your order number & account holder's name please? I'll ensure this is logged with everyone involved. Steven

column4: Sainsbury s. That roast turkey dinner in the cafe was awful. The turkey wasn t carved turkey  it was turkey slices that go in sandwiches  the roast potatoes were not cooked properly  the carrots were cold  the gravy was weak and watery  the stuffing was a small ball that was gone in a mouthful and the sausages were cocktail sausages. Who eats cocktail sausages with a roast dinner? The only decent thing was the Yorkshire puddings and the sprouts. Where was the bacon? That turkey roast dinner was like hospital food. After eating that garbage I was still hungry. A microwave turkey roast dinner is better. At least the turkey is pieces of carved turkey and the microwave version is cheaper.
column9: This was the West Hove branch. Also I'm always getting problems in that cafe at that branch. One time when I bought sausages and mash the mash was as tough as Poly Filler and no joke, I stuck my fork in the mash and managed to lift the entire lot off the plate. With proper mash that is soft you can't do that, the fork slides out of the mash. Some of the other meals had parts not cooked properly and others with parts that went cold. Sometimes the tea and coffee is cold and the fizzy drinks were quite warm. I'm never eating there again because the food is like hospital food in there and I can imagine like prison food. I said I can ""imagine"" it's like prison food and not ""like"" prison food because I've never been to prison.

column4: Unfortunately I forgot to bring  pound coin for the trolley this evening at Sainsburys in Leek. Customer Services and indeed the Store Manager were unable to assist with the release of a trolley.  In fairness they did offer to provide change but would have meant a withdrawal from the cashpoint just so I could shop in the store. I was told the store does operate a coined trolly system and there were no tokens available.  Having no alternative but to shop in another supermarket  I chose Morrisons in Buxton where I spent over Â£100.   I realise this won t put a dent in Sainsburys  annual profits  but poor customer service in my view.  I ll still continue to shop at Sainsburys but remember to take a pound coin.

column4: Do you accept your own brand used water filters for recycling in the Bedford or surrounding areas? I have tried asking in store on a couple of occasions (although not recently) and nobody seems to know!
column9: Hi Julia! You can recycle  filter cartridges in BRITA recycling â€˜binsâ€™ in selected retail stores. As Sainsburyâ€™s also sells BRITA branded products, our customers can use their bins to recycle cartridges. As the cartridges have multiple components, they cannot be recycled in the same way that recyclable household plastic packaging / products can be. You can use the BRITA website to locate a recycling store using the link below: http://www.brita.co.uk/brita/en-GB/cms/dealerfinder/dealerfinder.grid. Your local stores don't provide this service yet however  believe that Argos do this on a wider scale - it looks like the Argos at 12-16 The Harpur Centre MK40 1TP Bedford do this. Hope this helps. Maria

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  I am genuinely astonished at how incompetent you are. I ordered that really niche Christmas delicacy  a turkey (you might not of heard of it but it s sort of like a larger  uglier chicken) and apparently it is not available and there are no suitable substitutions. Not a single one to be had anywhere. I know these birds are really rare and you probably didn t anticipate someone wanting one at this time a year but thanks a bunch. I am sure I will have a totally non-stressful time finding one at over the next few days and it s not like I didn t place this order WEEKS ago (I placed it weeks ago). Christmas is ruined etc  insert Daily Mail-style sad face picture and so forth. In all seriousness  you owe me a turkey. I don t care what you have to do to get me a turkey but I want my turkey and I want it to be delivered tomorrow evening between 7pm and 8pm. Lots of love  Lauren
