column4: Very unsatisfied with Sainsburys and nectar this year  so much so I have stopped shopping there. Firstly we found out our nectar card was not exclusively ours and all our points we had collected were in fact going to another man who had spent them. Nectars response was have another one on a zero balance and start again... Reluctantly started again collected points in store over the remaining months of the year to use at Christmas. Went to the till yesterday with the points in order to redeem them only to be told the card wasn t registering and we could only add the points from our shop. Customer services response in store was when you next shop here (we don t shop in Sainsburys anymore specially went to spend our points) you can use your points on your shopping and they also told us that the till worker should have called them over  they would have saved the transaction then called nectar and it could have been resolved  so now Sainsburys are also not training their till staff properly! I can t believe nectar and Sainsburys are so non plused about nectar espically with the Incident of the other person using our card  these points have monitory value!  And home delivery  one of the hotest days in summer I was 35 weeks pregnant  delivery driver turns up on my door and dumps the crates on my door step  no help carrying them in and stood there whilst I struggled heavily pregnant moving our Â£100 worth of shopping into the kitchen. No offer of help once  I get its hot and he most likely couldn t be bothered with the amount of drops he had to do but bending over and up again numerous times to bring my shopping in at 35 weeks pregnant was not fun! And funnily enough I was hot too!! Not happy Sainsburys outraged and disappointed by your service this year! Won t be shopping with you again online or in store! #BBCWatchdog
column9: Hi Danny it was the Aylesford store. Regards

And home delivery  one of the hotest days in summer I was 35 weeks pregnant  delivery driver turns up on my door and dumps the crates on my door step  no help carrying them in and stood there whilst I struggled heavily pregnant moving our Â£100 worth of shopping into the kitchen. No offer of help once  I get its hot and he most likely couldn t be bothered with the amount of drops he had to do but bending over and up again numerous times to bring my shopping in at 35 weeks pregnant was not fun! And funnily enough I was hot too!! Not happy Sainsburys outraged and disappointed by your service this year! Won t be shopping with you again online or in store! #BBCWatchdog

column4: My care assistant and her daughter  went to Sainsbury in kiddermister Worcestershire yesterday evening to do her Christmas  food and get the cat food  but all the  shelving  was empty shelving  nothing was  filling the shelves  and we were four days off Christmas day   my  carer and her daughter Amy  hasn t got any shopping  as all the  shelving was empty shelving waiting for stock to be put out  on desplay in Sainsbury  kiddermister Worcestershire . what is Sainsbury doing as we pop in to Sainsbury s merry hill Dudley and their shelving was  fully fledged with stock?  her daughter Amy has only got Christmas day off  as she is working over Christmas and new year eve and new year day   shawl y you have enough shopworkers to get the stock out on display in the shelves ?

column4: Never been so angry in my life! Today I went in to my local Sainsburys and tried to buy Christmas presents containing alcohol. At the age of 36 this should be fine because I definitely don t look under 18 and I don t believe I even look under 25  especially not today when I am ill. Despite having photographic ID with my date of birth on it  I was refused. I am in there almost every day spending a fortune and they know me. But that didn t matter. It may or may not have something to do with the fact I mystery shopped them a few weeks ago. Who knows. But that is irrelevant. I am a paying customer  who was sober and had proper ID. Cheeky so-and-so had the nerve to smirk and ask if I still wanted my non-alcoholic shopping. I will never darken their door again! This is really disappointing especially as I had written blogs promoting your brand in the past!
column9: Not good enough. Your response is unreasonable. At what age should a person stop carrying ID? Would my 80 year old grandfather be refused because he doesn't have ID? I am 36, not 26. This is nothing more than a witch hunt because I mystery shopped them!

column4: So how many of you know that they won t allow a delivery to be accepted by an under 18? No age related items in the delivery and if that is their policy why do they give the 18+ notice when you order alcohol? My delivery was scheduled for 8 to 9am  me having taken the day of work to spend time with my son who will be 16 in 8 weeks time. Unfortunately I broke a tooth and had an emergency dental appointment at 8.30. I left home at 8.20  the delivery had not yet turned up but my son was home and had instructions to text of he was unsure about the substitutions. They arrived at 8.39 and refused to deliver as it is their policy! I was home before 9 and called customer services  they said the driver was now out of the area but would be back in the area at 12. She w old call to arrange delivery - I m still waiting. Instead of going for lunch and the cinema with my son in now just eating my entire day waiting to be contacted about my Christmas food delivery.
column9: Hi Sharon, I'm really sorry about this but unfortunately, the Ts&Cs state that ""You or someone aged 18 or over on your behalf must be available to receive, inspect and sign for your grocery order."" column4: Not sure who s order you were looking at as cancelled online Sainsbury cos mine is still online as I was hoping for a more positive response having been a loyal customer for 40 years but obviously that cuts no ice with Sainsbury s even in this competitive market ! Orders should not be taken  if they cannot be fulfilled.  This is the first time I ve looked at your own website and it s obvious Im not the only customer you have let down this Christmas .      Judging by the amount of customers you have upset over the past few days with this issue I ll be surprised if they continue shopping with you as I certainly will be moving elsewhere.  No point being loyal to a brand that has no interest in customer relation.   You may be having an extremely busy Christmas period but you still have January onwards and I m sure and hope your footfall and online sales  will drop as customers you have dealt with this badly will not return and judging by your Facebook page there are a lot of  people from Aberdeen and all over the country not getting a turkey with their online shop . Maybe one if your staff could nip to Waitrose or Morrisons or Marks and Spencer and but enough to use for  your own orders !!  Shamefully treatment of customers and to tell me I can have a refund in 3 to 5 days and have a nice evening is taking the  P .  In capital letters !!!!!!!  You can start counting me as your first footfall loss for  the New Year !    Sue cannon

column4: Dear Sainsburys  I had my Christmas shopping delivered last night. 20th Dec seemed a sensible date to me. I m very disappointed that almost all of my shopping for Christmas dinner is out of date 21st  22nd  23rd! Surely the shopper would realise it was for Christmas dinner? Now I have to go out to the supermarket and re buy it all. With three small children and a chronic pain syndrome  this isn t what I wanted to be doing. Naomi Thomas
column9: Hi Naomi. Sorry you're disappointed with your products. If a product has the same date as your delivery date, or has been substituted, weâ€™ll pop it in a blue bag if youâ€™ve elected for bagged delivery. For bagless orders, weâ€™ll highlight on your delivery paperwork so you can easily check. If youâ€™re not happy with any of the products we've picked for you, let your driver know and they will return it for a full refund. Dee

column4: I would like to say a MASSIVE thank you to customer service advisor   Lynn Jordan  at the Watchmoor Park Camberley store. She deserves praise for going out of her way to help me.  After receiving the Christmas order catelogue through the door in November   my 2 year old son and husband did some some  cutting and sticking  using the pictures and made a picture of what they would like for Christmas from Father Christmas! Among other things  my son had chosen the  polar bear cake  and my husband the  Limoncello Buche De Noel  .  I didn t realise these were Christmas order only products and had been repeatedly checking in store and on the normal online section. My son kept on saying how much he wanted the cake and didn t seem to forget about it.  In desperation  I went to customer service last week. Lynn Jordan  explained about the Xmas ordering ..... but I had missed the last date!  She explained that sometimes surplus come in store and she would check for me.  Today  she phoned me saying she had successfully got for them for me! She also explained that she had asked her husband to look in the store he works in AND had even discussed with one of the bakers in store about making me an equivalent if need be!  This was exemplary service.  As a consequence of her help   I will have a happy 2 year old and husband on Christmas day.  In addition  she have me a voucher for quadruple nectar points.  A HUGE thank you to get. I hope she received this message and that management recognise her brilliant service to me.
column9: Thank you.

And after my shop he saw me loading the car and although already busy moving trolleys he stopped and took mine back for me too  along with the half eaten bread rolls the kids had left in there which he insisted on taking to the bin for me ðŸ˜Š returned later in the day and he was still working so hard helping lots of customers! column4: Why do Sainsburys continue to issue Bonus Nectar Point vouchers for products that are no longer available? It is particularly annoying when they are things I like  that I want to buy for their own sake (as I have before)  and which I go to my store to get  only to find they have been discontinued. One recent example is the 4-pack of Basics avocados (70 points voucher - the last of several - expired 8/11/16)  and (most frustratingly  as I have bought a pack once a month for years) Sainsburys 1 kg Wholewheat Muesli (formerly called  no added sugar ). I had assumed it was only my local (Wandsworth) store - but in fact neither of them seems to be available anywhere. This is completely bonkers.
column9: Hi Ossie, sorry you're having trouble with this. I've had a look and I can see that these are the avocados you're referring to: http://bit.ly/1UcCQ2U however they're not labelled as our 'Basics' range and this may be where the confusion is coming from with the team in store. Unfortunately it seems we've stopped stocking the muesli though. If you PM me over your Nectar card number, I'll get some points added to make up for missing the coupon offer and we'll log a product request for you and see if we can start stocking the muesli again! Ryan.

column4: Just wanted to highlight your wonderful staff at sainsbury s local in Earlsfield  London. She s recently been diagnosed with bladder cancer and has to use the bathroom frequently. Upon finding the public toilets in store were out of order  she approached one of your staff to explain the situation and they allowed her use of the staff toilet  no questions asked and with no hesitation. Thank you so much for being so understanding and accommodating.. It really meant a lot to her â¤ï¸
column9: Hi Heather! That's great, I'm glad our colleagues were able to help your mother. I've passed your feedback on to our store management team. Give your mother our best and have a nice evening. Andy

column4: Dear Sainsbury s   Call me presumptuous  but I think the point of stocking fresh turkeys in your stores is to offer your customers the option of  you know  fresh turkeys  ones you don t have to defrost for hours. Fresh turkeys that all have one half frozen kind of defeat the purpose. You may want to let your Spilsby store know this.  And possibly ship them a whole bunch of new fresh turkeys.  And a refrigerator repair worker.

She made the xmas food shop so easy  especially when I d copied ingredients out of a recipe book and I didn t actually know what they were!!! The hugest of thanks

column4: Just back from Sainsbury s  who clearly have a different concept of Customer Service to Waitrose. I was attempting to achieve a refund of Â£3.55 for a (child s) magazine purchased in error. Apparently  as I bought said magazine 9 days ago   we can t resell it . I was tempted to explain that I wasn t returning a rotten / putrefying f***ing cabbage  but thought the better of it. A supervisor was then summoned  but took about 15 minutes to appear. Said supervisor felt the need to seek higher authority  and tried to phone the deity..... no reply  so  I ll need to go and find someone . I gave up at this stage. Never again !!
column9: North Cheam store. Didn't catch anyone's name. In the end, I kept the magazine and will pass it on to one of my grand-children.  PS You need to put more staff on Customer Service desk, particularly at this time of year.

column4: Wondering in dismay  why our local store (kelso) would refuse to donate any edible waste to help people who would normally be on their own in rural areas  have a Christmas lunch with others in the same predicament.  Shame on you Sainsburys!   The reason given from said store  was they will be too busy this week with 50000+ customers to deal with?! Surely this is even more reason to donate instead of dump your edible waste and help those who need it. It is the season of goodwill after all..

column4: Hi sainsburys I wanted to express my disappointment and frustration when visiting a local sainsburys store tonight to see the Christmas gifts I had bought at the start of December (and now wrapped and posted) reduced from Â£6 to Â£1.80! Why will I bother buying my gifts from you next year when their value will reduce by nearly 75%well before Christmas day?

column9: Hi sas,   They did not arrive. Called them again at 21:00 and they told us that we won't be getting our order today, arranged a slot for 7am-8am in the morn (obviously lied when they said our order was loaded in the truck). They rang us back at 22:00, getting us out of bed to say they could not honour the slot. Requested 6-7pm, again, couldn't 'promise'! Had a huge row with the lost slots manager who refused to give his or his managers surname so I could raise the matter formally. Because of this I have cancelled the order. To much stress. My number was 157749582.

column4: i am absolutely disgusted in your staffs customer service. Today at about 3.30 in our local branch (Cotgrave) my 6 year old daughter was sick whilst in the que. another member of the public informed your staff and they said they would be right with us. I didn t want to leave it for anyone else to clean up or step in it. 20 minutes it took and multiple comments off members of the public to your staff before someone came to help us. She was clearly distressed and embarrassed by what had happened and was left for everyone to see. And then when someone finally did come they had no compassion towards us at all. The only member of staff in that store that showed any customer service to us was a new member of staff who as I am aware has only been with you for a week. They were more bothered about getting the que down which in all honesty never goes down quickly than dealing with a issue which carries a health hazard. Yes I know it is only a job in a shop and you don t expect to be dealing with these things but you are meant to employ staff with customer skills not 1 person who helped us today had any of these. I for one will not be using that branch again until I know your staff carry the basic skills it takes to be a customer retail assistant.
column9: Hi Heather, really sorry about this, I hope she is OK? We expect better than that from our colleagues. Can I ask if you got the names of the colleagues you spoke with?  If so, can you PM us their names please? I'll feed it back to the store. Daryl.

column4: Love soups! but OMG how horrible is the new limited edition soup Beef Bone Broth with pearl barley! It smells awful took me a while to work out what it was   my husband came home for lunch and I gave him some of this soup without saying anything and watched his reaction!   Yuk! what is this? it tastes and smells  of Aniseed!  I then realised that that was what it was!  So very disappointed in this soup and can t imagine what on earth possessed the manufactures to put a pungent smelly flavour like aniseed in a soup! So be warned.

column4: Sainsbury s please sort out your internet service. I have just tried to click on the check out button on my iPad app to confirm and pay for my Christmas order  and nothing!! Not a sausage happening. I then went online to the website to find it had shut down till 2am!!!! For maintenance  a week before Christmas? I have attempted to stay up in order to recover my order but with a school run to do in the morning and a cold to fight off  tiredness has beaten me  and I have now resigned myself to going to bed.  I didn t get a change to check out  thus confirming my order  I only have to hope that you have saved my entered items and that my time hasn t been wasted once again (My order didn t reach me last week due to your system failing) I will be most frustrated if I have to have another evening wasted tapping my shop in from scratch!  This is terrible customer service  and very poor planning/timing on Sainsbury s part  especially during an extremely  busy time of year too. I can t stress how frustrating this is and only hope I can find my order tomorrow.
column9: Driving me nuts, wonder if they have been hacked

Not a sausage happening. I then went online to the website to find it had shut down till 2am!!!! For maintenance  a week before Christmas? I have attempted to stay up in order to recover my order but with a school run to do in the morning and a cold to fight off  tiredness has beaten me  and I have now resigned myself to going to bed.  I didn t get a change to check out  thus confirming my order  I only have to hope that you have saved my entered items and that my time hasn t been wasted once again (My order didn t reach me last week due to your system failing) I will be most frustrated if I have to have another evening wasted tapping my shop in from scratch!  This is terrible customer service  and very poor planning/timing on Sainsbury s part  especially during an extremely  busy time of year too. I can t stress how frustrating this is and only hope I can find my order tomorrow.
column9: The time for next  day delivery was passed when i was still making changes for Tuesday, it makes sense doing work on the website after that time but if that's the case they should have warned us

column4: Soooo annoyed!!!!!! Have wasted so much time tonight trying to redeem nectar points to help pay for my Christmas shop and its not working properly  can t redeem my full amount if points  wouldn t let me redeem Â£10 worth  would only my let me redeem two Â£5  vouchers  which I ve now found out I can t use on the same shop!!!! column9: The wallet is  only visible  when using certain devices ,Katy, as I found out when I was searching for my vouchers. column4: I ve just spent over an hour filling up my online basket  only to reach the section where I choose a delivery slot  to find that there are NO SLOTS available until 27th December. Today is 1th...what is that all about?? It s a whole week until Christmas! So now  at nearly 8 months pregnant I face having to go and do this instore...and I won t get my evening back. Some kind of warning on the web page may have been useful  or even an email telling me that delivery slots are filling up  or SOMETHING to stop me completely wasting my time. If I have to trudge round the shops I suppose I might as well go to Aldi and save myself a bit of money. I bet my shopping list won t cost me Â£150 there. I m thoroughly disappointed.

column4: Dear Sainsburys   i am a regular customer and love your products. however it has turned out i have got more than what i bargained for when i decided to buy your wrapping paper. if id of known what the implications would of been when i unwrapped the wrapping paper  i would of covered the whole house and wore a coverall and goggles. I m extremely unsatisfied with this purchase  as not only has it ruined the Christmas presents that it came in contact with  i now have sparkly dogs  carpet  furniture and anything i have put in the washing machine since the unfortunate encounter with said wrapping paper. Now as this may seem wonderful to have sparkling Rottweilers and sparkly underwear  but i can assure you it has been quite uncomfortable for my partner and the dogs. Please put a warning label on your Merry christmas wrapping paper as this has been a very unpleasant experience. kind regards  a grumpy lady with very glittery dogs!
column9: Oh dear, sorry about the glittery disaster Katie! I like a bit of sparkle, but glittery dogs might be too much. Do you have still have the barcode or receipt for the wrapping paper? Which store did you get it from? Leigh

column4: That looks good enough to eat - from me that s a real compliment will get it written down.. thanks darlin  xx
column9: Haha... I think that was meant for me. Love you mum x

column4: My colleagues at work are receiving special offers and vouchers to use in store but I have not received a single communication from Sainsbury s  despite being a loyal customer for over 15 years.  How do I sign up or add my name to the mailing list for these offers please?
column9: Hi Hanlie! You need to make sure you have opted in to allowing Nectar to share your details with third parties. That way we get your details and you will receive mailings. Maria

column4: I spent  Â£173 in Sainsbury s on food and drink but only got nectar points on Â£158 #sainsbury s why is that?
column9: There is a list of products that you cannot receive nectar points on,  including  first stage baby milk,  stamps, spirits and liqueurs, tobacco,   Lloyd's pharmacy products, Have you any of those ?

column4: I spent  Â£173 in Sainsbury s on food and drink but only got nectar points on Â£158 #sainsbury s why is that?

column9: Hi Joanna, I've contacted the store management and passed on your feedback. Thanks so much for getting in touch! Daryl.

column4: Hi Sainsburys. Please could you look into how we are to redeem the discount of 20% off our shopping at Sainsburys which is offered with the SIU security industry united card.  My partner and I did our Christmas shop in your Salisbury store today  as he has this union member card offering a discount and also has another discount card from his employer which is ment to have the same benefit. The cashier did not know of either of them and called her supervisor who claimed that they weren t accepted  but it s still showing as a discount on the cards sites. We just had to pay up the undiscounted price and thought I d ask you here as they are clearly swamped in store with the rush and didn t know  rather than inconveniencing everyone else in the queue and the staff by trying to get it sorted then and there. If someone could get back to me about this when you have a spare few minutes that would be great. Many thanks  -Gemma
column9: Hey Gemma. We don't accept SIU cards in stores. With regards to the other card, was it a business gift card? Thanks, Ash.

column9: Hey Jay! Sorry about that. Which store did you buy these items in? Can you send us the barcodes? We'll look into this for you. Ash.

column4: We would just like to thank the staff in your cafe at arnison centre  Durham.  On Friday we came in early for breakfast with our 3 day old baby.  It was my husbands birthday too. While my husband was ordering food he was telling the lady as she was asking about the little one. He also told her it is my birthday on the 19th. .... A busy month!! As we were eating our breakfast two members of staff approached and presented us with a food hamper to say congratulations and happy birthday to both of us.  Was a lovely thought and nice surprise!  Thank you very much!
column9: Wow, how lovely . Well done sainsburys xx

column4: I need to thank all the staff of Plymouth Armada Way store who helped and looked after me for 3 hours today  In particular huge thanks go to Paula  Shelley  Karen  Maria  Bill  Mikayla and another gentleman in black. I could not get a locksmith to come out. They gave me cups of tea  hugs  they loaned me their phones  rang companies for me  gave tissues for my tears and finally decided to get into my car for me ( with great success gentlemen). Nothing was too much trouble for any of them on a very busy Saturday. They went over and beyond for me and I can t thank them enough. We had such excitement as I finally drove off. Thanking you all for your help xxx
column9: Was in a right state as all my contact numbers for my family were on my phone in the boot, also my house keys. I had breakdown cover with my insurance but I couldn't remember the insurance company I was with as I recently changed ! They were brilliant staff and had so much patience trying to find a solution. The car park attendant and a member of staff finally got in after 3 hours with my aerial from the car which we decided to snap off xx

column4: Could you teach your delivery drivers some manners  please?  I was trying to drive down my road  albeit quite a narrow road  and one of your drivers had blocked the road with his van. column4: I have a complaint to make regarding an  alleged  policy! I bought  from your Pontllanfraith (South Wales) store  a piece of ham to boil. I incorrectly bought smoked ham  instead of normal non smoked ham. Upon returning home and putting my shopping away I realised my error  and returned straight back to the store with my receipt and the piece of ham  hoping to exchange it for a non smoked piece of ham  only to be told by a member of staff that there is a 20 minute return policy on fresh foods  and as I was slightly over that timescale  I was unable to make an exchange - leaving me with a Â£7+ piece of ham that will now go to waste. It wasn t as if I was trying to return the ham days later  I was just outside your alleged exchange timescale  and although I then looked in store  I was unable to find this policy displayed anywhere!! I am extremely disappointed with this experience  as I am a single parent and do not have money like this to waste.
column9: How then is this policy enforced on home deliveries, replacement products etc?

Upon returning home and putting my shopping away I realised my error  and returned straight back to the store with my receipt and the piece of ham  hoping to exchange it for a non smoked piece of ham  only to be told by a member of staff that there is a 20 minute return policy on fresh foods  and as I was slightly over that timescale  I was unable to make an exchange - leaving me with a Â£7+ piece of ham that will now go to waste. It wasn t as if I was trying to return the ham days later  I was just outside your alleged exchange timescale  and although I then looked in store  I was unable to find this policy displayed anywhere!! I am extremely disappointed with this experience  as I am a single parent and do not have money like this to waste.
column9: That's a long way to write ""Waaaahhhhhhhhh!"".

column4: Dear Sir / Madam  My mother has a nectar card which she has 18 pounds on. We have changed from Tesco to sainsburys as we perfer your quality of food. Like the fruit is better quality and lasts longer than Tesco. So what we would like to know as we have the points we don t know what to do. Can we spend them for shopping if that is the case that would help us for Christmas. We have told other people we know about sainsburys as people assume that only people who have a lot of money go there for shopping. But we have found your prices are competitive.  Thank you  Darren Morris
column9: Hi Darren, you sure can! As long as you've shopped in the store you plan to spend your points in beforehand, it will be fine. If you're visiting a new store you'll need to ask the customer service team to call Nectar and enable you to spend points there (it's a security measure). You can spend them in 500 point increments which are worth Â£2.50 each. You'll have no problem redeeming Â£17.50 and the remaining 50p of points will be left on your card! Ryan.

column4: hi we have been having your home delivery service for about 9 weeks very good and drivers we have met always polite so question is it okay give driver this christmas with out him or her getting introuble john ps happy christmas/new year
column9: You mean a tip? If so just give it to them, but dont tell the store you gave the driver money. Something to do with it being extra income they wont pay tax on. If you give the driver money they are hardly going to alert their employer. A friend of mine works for asda home delivery and he gets tips all the time. It adds up, but ita against company policy to accept tips. One a customer phoned up to complain and she mentioned she'd tipped the driver before she noticed some items were missing. He just said he put it in a charity box. They couldnt prove he hadnt.

column9: Hey Sally, serving our customers wherever and whenever they want is at the heart of what we do. Where there is a demand, we will always try to meet this to better serve our customers. Maclaine

column4: Re; Sainsbury s Butchers Choice Pork Sausages As regular Sainsbury s customer we are often impressed by the quality of your produce and the quick thinking and friendly service of your staff. This given  unfortunately on this occasion we come to you not with praise though instead with displeasure in the quality of one of your products. As Australians with a fondness for a good snag from the barby we expectedly find the group craving a quality sausage in a bun on the regular occasion  sadly your Sainsbury s Butchers Choice Pork Sausages do not seem to meet our expectations. The meat has a heavily processed taste and a soft rubber like texture once cooked which is not comparable with other higher quality sausages found on the common market. As a group  we would like to suggest the Sainsbury s butcher section considers updating this product to meet a higher standard of taste and finish.  Please take our suggestions into consideration and proceed as you see best fit Kind regards A bunch of snag loving Aussies.
column9: Hey Jonathan, sorry the product hasn't been up to scratch. We take all customer feedback seriously so I'll make sure our suppliers are aware of this. Can you tell me which store you got it from and can you send me a snap of the barcode? Ryan.

column4: Can you confirm your policy on unsold bread close to closing time please?   I was in my local branch and asked the staff who were clearing the shelves of bakery bread if it was going to be marked down. They said no  it was going to be thrown away.   On asking another employee if that was because unsold food was given to a homeless shelter / foodbank I was told no  it was actually thrown away.  If this is the case can you confirm why a low risk food item is wasted in this way when it could go to feeding those who need it. Thanks.
column9: Hey. Really sorry about this. All of our bakery products carry the risk of cross contamination in which case cannot be given to food banks due to allergy risk.However, none of our food will be sent to landfill, it will be either recycled to animal feed or converted to bio-fuel through anaerobic digestion. None bakery items will be sent to foodbanks. Kelly

column4: Hi    My husband and I went to Craigleith (Edinburgh) Retail Park Sainsburyâ€™s petrol station on the 16th December 2016 around 13:00 pm. column4: Sainsburys leamington spa: I was in the main store earlier today and to keep my 2 yr old happy she had picked up a chocolate polar bear she was allowed to eat if she was good all the way round  which she was but as we got to the check out she broke down in tears as it had melted and in her eyes was  broken   and she couldn t eat jt.  I was in the process of saying it would be ok after we put it in the fridge and comforting her when a member of staff came over snd swapped it for a new one ! column9: Hi Sas, sorry no I think the lady I saw instore took it when she told me the policy. I don't actually use these cards normally and I think I either got it as a present from a friend or as a prize in a competition. I'm really sorry I can't give you more information, it's been a bit of a year and so I'm only just sorting things out. column4: Went into a store last Friday to buy some bits and pieces and paid with my card  when checking my bank statement I noticed in had been charged twice for the goods that I brought. Taking the weekend into consideration I left it. I checked my bank yesterday (thursday) to find that it hadn t been refunded so returned to store. I was then advised that it is in the  air  and it can take up to a week to be returned. I was then advised that it is in the  air  and it can take up to a week to be returned. I am not sure what  air  means... son would appreciate it if one of your team members on here could explain?!?  they can see from my statement that it was taken twice and all I want is the second payment back.
column9: Omg

column4: Pretty disappointed with your stores cafe yet AGAIN. I shop in sainsburys quite often and when I have my one year old we do like to stop for a drink and snack. The first time we attempted this  I ordered a skinny cappuccino. The lady made my cappuccino and presented me with it saying  I ve made it with full fat milk because we ve got no skimmed ... that s not what I ordered  so I wasted my money  no apology or offer of a refund. Second visit we fancied lunch  no kids toasties left and no jacket potatoes  so we left after queueing for 10 minutes  why can you not manage some signage? How does a supermarket run out of everyday items?! Today I visited to have breakfast in the cafe. No shopping  just breakfast with my daughter... your toaster is broken  all we wanted was toast - waste of time again.   I never write reviews  but I m so disappointed that a supermarket can have  stock issues   I m pretty reasonable but I think you need to rethink your menu if you can t supply half of it!

column4: Good evening Sainsbury s.  I have a Filter Coffee Maker  one of your own brand models  and I ve had a mishap with a part of it. Now  clearly the machine still works but in an ideal situation I need to get that safety valve sorted out.  Any ideas  please?
column9: We think that the the spring has been mistakenly put inside the filter holder and pushed the rubber seal on top of it there which would leave the valve constantly open. This is actually a lot harder to do than the correct fitting. If the parts are correctly assembled and the filter holder is still leaking then it is possible that the rubber seal or drip hole is damaged. If you're still having problems fitting this then we can supply a replacement assembled unit. Megan.

column4: I would just like to take the time to personally thank a member of your team! Tracey from your Guildhall Exeter branch deserves acknowledgement for going out of her way to help out my elderly neighbours. column4: A little dissapointed with sainsburys cafe today :-( we eat there pretty regularly and have never had any complaints as yet but today wasn t great! After arriving at 11.45 and being told they had already  sold out  of ham egg and chips (my guess is they didnt have any to start with) we chose a brunch and Christmas dinner. After waiting over half an hour (being told there was a 20 min wait) the food arrived. The xmas dinner was mostly cold and the veg was practically raw. My brunch was nice apart from the black sausage and slight lack of mushrooms...I eventually found them...two teeny weeny shrivelled ones! I would have complained at the time but it was so busy myself and my nan didn t want to add to the complaints as a few others had also complained about missing orders and wrong orders! On a plus side the chips were lovely and my nan said her roast potatos were the best bit of her meal too!  Needless to say I think we will be giving sainsburys cafe a miss for a while! (Attached pic of my black sausage and measly mushrooms in comments)
column9: I'm really sorry about that Bethan! This certainly isn't up to our high standards! Could you tell us what store this happened in? I'll make sure that this is fed back to the store's management team for the appropriate action to be taken. Paddy

column4: Hi   Has anyone else had Sainsbury s cooper pan explode.   By this I mean the covers that goes over the rivets.  I was cooking a steak and all of a sudden a loud bang that I thought was a Gas s issue only to find the rivet cover flying off and hitting like a bullet slashing me with hot fat.   Luckily no major damage just ruined a t shirt and scared us to death as I said thinking it was a gas explosion.   Thought it may have been just a one off then another did the same.   Is there a recall on these as I have prised the other rivets off all the pans as I bought a full set and need to use them (my only set of pans) and was lucky no one was harmed or possibly lost an eye.
column9: I'm so sorry about that Bill! I'm glad you're okay. Can you send us a picture of the damage please? Holly

column4: Hi   Has anyone else had Sainsbury s cooper pan explode.   By this I mean the covers that goes over the rivets.  I was cooking a steak and all of a sudden a loud bang that I thought was a Gas s issue only to find the rivet cover flying off and hitting like a bullet slashing me with hot fat.   Luckily no major damage just ruined a t shirt and scared us to death as I said thinking it was a gas explosion.   Thought it may have been just a one off then another did the same.   Is there a recall on these as I have prised the other rivets off all the pans as I bought a full set and need to use them (my only set of pans) and was lucky no one was harmed or possibly lost an eye.
column9: No sorry had them for about a year now that's why it took us by supplies. No t shirt in the bin but I'm not worried about that and now I've removed the caps it won't happen again but people need to be aware of the potential issues especially if a child is the kitchen.   I'm not looking for a refund or any thing like that just that people are aware.

column4: You majorly failed me today :(  Did an online order for today 6 days ago for my school christmas parties.   I ordered 40 boxes of cup drinks. 40 multipacks of crisps.  12 multipacks of haribo.  Says on the website when you ve ordered that for bulk orders they ll phone you before if there s and problems. Didn t hear anything so was looking forward to it all arriving.   You delivered 11 out of 40 boxes of drinks (plus random substitutes) 20 out 40 packs of crisps (plus random substitutes) 0 out of 12 packs of haribo with no substitute.  Delivery driver was suprised no one had phoned to tell me 66% of my order would not be delivered!!!  Hadn t had a sainsburys order before so asked driver about price promise on substitutions. He said there wasn t one - so i was in a difficult position and had to send some of the more expensive drinks back.  Turns out he was wrong and i could have kept those drinks at the price I d ordered.  So spent my evening chasing round for haribo and drinks that sainsburys should have let me know weren t coming. If I d have known 66% of the order wasn t coming I d have told you no to bother.  Very dissapointed. Wont be shopping online with sainsburys again.
column9: Hey. I'm really sorry this is not the level of service we expect our customers to have! Can you PM us your order number, name of the account holder and post code? Kelly.

column4: Sainsbury s Christmas Food to Order is very misleading.  Having put my Christmas order in last week I was told the turkey I wanted was  out of stock .  Not what you are led to believe by their  Order by 15th December  message.  Having spoken to their Customer Services Dept. I was told I would be rung by latest Tuesday with an update but received no phone call  have had to call again today and although apologetic have been unable to supply the turkey.  So BEWARE when you put your order in  you may not get what you want for Christmas  be prepared to shop elsewhere.

column4: I would just like to say a huge thankyou to your amazing team at Ripon.   I called in to the Ripon store this evening and assumed I d left a bag with my wedding veil and many other important wedding items in it only 10 days before our wedding!!! In a bit of a fluster I called and spoke to a lovely chap. I believe he then transferred me to Mark at Customer services.   He very kindly put my mind at rest that he would do all the could  he d check the CCTV for me  and even scoured the car park. Amazingly he found it in the car park completely in tactðŸ˜„!!!  My mum went to collect it all for me to be greeted with a gorgeous card  a bottle of bubbly and some beautiful flowers. She was completely taken by surprise and welled up!!   This has restored my faith in man kind and shows what a truly great team you have.   Thankyou so so much   Abbie ðŸ˜„

column4: Just had a telephone conversation with Gary from the Executive Office!  The phone call didn t solve anything but Gary made me laugh a lot and I now find myself feeling strangely sorry for tall men who might put their backs out bending down if the shelf heights were lower!  Also feeling sad for any students who may wish to buy one or two loose new potatoes - imagine their horror if they found said potatoes had been moved below their head height so older shoppers could reach them!  How would they manage?  I suppose they could just ask a colleague for help!  Thanks for making me laugh Gary!  You will go far young man!

column4: Just ordered my first Sainsburys online shop  and had some trouble with a voucher code. Phoned the Newry based call centre (which is open till 11pm) and spoke to a really helpful guy who went above and beyond and sorted it out in jiffy. Such excellent customer service is rare these days  but delighted to find that your online service is just as helpful and accommodating as the in store shopping experience. Thanks Sainsburys!
column9: You're welcome Sarah! Hayley

column4: Shocker!! Sorry to be one of those social media complainers but here I am! So I bought two Christmas presents online 4/12/16. Today I decided to call and see where said items are? A very unhelpful man on the phone informed me that both items were out of stock and cancelled at the warehouse! When exactly was I going to be advised? Rather annoyed that I hadn t been told this was the case  the call was ended. On reflection I thought I am sure my account had been debited so I checked and indeed it had on the 8/12/16 surely you would check stock levels before accepting an order and taking payment?? So again I call to be met with another even less helpful man who when asked why I was charged for an order that was never going to be fulfilled - his answer was it s the busiest time of year we can t contact everyone! Really not my problem there should be systems in place to ensure this is avoided! His whole attitude was poor and there was no apology and now I have to source replacement gifts while waiting a week to get my money back when it should have never been taken! One very unhappy and disappointed customer who won t be rushing back to Sainsburys anytime soon!
column9: I am so sorry that this happened Chris! This is certainly not the kind of service we expect any of our colleagues to give to our customers. Can you please send me details of what products you had bought? Thanks, Gabby

column4: Dear Santa Sainsburys.   I have been a pretty loyal Sainsbury s shopper this year  and a good girl  but I m feeling a little shafted. I m aware that there was a change to the way Nectar points function  but am more than a little crushed to discover that my roughly Â£4 000 of spending at Sainsbury s has amounted to precisely Â£20.48 in Nectar points. I ve shopped there nearly every week for a whole year and for my loyalty I can t even afford to buy one weeks  shopping! A competing supermarket (thou who shalt not be named)  who have received far less of our business  have given us over Â£50 worth of spending. Surely I can t be the only one who feels their loyalty is not exactly being rewarded?! I m coeliac so my food costs a lot more every week than most people s and we rely on points to help pay for our Christmas shop. Now I will struggle to buy my favourite cheeses from you as well as crackers and bread to go with them. What will we do without our cheeses?! *sob*   Quietly sobbing in the corner   Vikki Cook
column9: Never heard of it!

column4: Dear Santa Sainsburys.   I have been a pretty loyal Sainsbury s shopper this year  and a good girl  but I m feeling a little shafted. I m aware that there was a change to the way Nectar points function  but am more than a little crushed to discover that my roughly Â£4 000 of spending at Sainsbury s has amounted to precisely Â£20.48 in Nectar points. I ve shopped there nearly every week for a whole year and for my loyalty I can t even afford to buy one weeks  shopping! A competing supermarket (thou who shalt not be named)  who have received far less of our business  have given us over Â£50 worth of spending. Surely I can t be the only one who feels their loyalty is not exactly being rewarded?! I m coeliac so my food costs a lot more every week than most people s and we rely on points to help pay for our Christmas shop. Now I will struggle to buy my favourite cheeses from you as well as crackers and bread to go with them. What will we do without our cheeses?! *sob*   Quietly sobbing in the corner   Vikki Cook
column9: Good morning dearest Victoria, we certainly don't want you to miss out on your favourite crackers and cheese. Allowing you to sob quietly in the corner won't let us carry on enjoying this festive cheer. Nectar changed for a year, (We now offer 1 point per Â£1 instead of 2 points per Â£1) but you should have more than just Â£20 to spare. I'll need to ask a couple of questions to offer the best possible suggestion. Can you let us know which store you shop in? Also PM us your Nectar card number? Faiza.

column9: Have you registered your card on Sainsbury's ""Mycoupons"" online Victoria?......you get bonus vouchers on different products to load to your card (5 at a time) as well as double points when you spend over a certain amount and they change every 3 weeks.....I've been doing it since March and have used 62 vouchers and my points from it add up to over Â£60, with my till points I've now got Â£105 since January :)

column4: Are you aware of the serious quality issues relating to your frozen British Button Sprouts? A significant number in the bag I recently opened were severely discoloured with a yellowish brown core and had to be discarded. Even those that weren t discoloured had an unpleasant  tainted taste and consequently I have thrown the whole bag out.  I have just checked product reviews on your website and most of the recent ones give a one star rating. Comments include  Bitter. Threw them in the bin    Unpleasant bitter earthy taste    awful    Pickled - tastes horrible  and  Bad bad and bad again . What is going on?
column9: Thank you for letting us know about this Graeme! I'd love to get this fed back to our buyers. Thank you for also letting us know about the comments for this product! If you DM us your Nectar card number, I'll get this logged and I'll also pop some points on your card as a refund. Thanks, sas

column4: I would like to say how disappointed and disgraceful your customer service is. I placed an order to click and collect at my store in Shrewsbury on 30th November which I find out tonight was delivered to Blackheath. The only option your customer service gave me was to go to Blackheath to collect myself or have a refund as you don t send orders between stores. It is too far to go myself and frankly I don t see why I should make the journey when it s your mistake. All but 1 of the items I ordered are now out of stock  well  actually they re not as they re sitting in Blackheath store  but you re unwilling to sort your own mistake out. You d think you d make the effort to get orders to people  especially at this time of year. Very disappointed and won t be buying from you online again. Zero points for customer support.
column9: Hi Julie, sorry that you had a bad online experience. Can you PM me your order number so that I can look into a little further for you. Paul

column4: Sainsbury s  can you tell me why you supply your staff with round metal steps for stacking items on higher shelves but then expect the poor customer to be a gymnast when buying said items?  Last week in your Tonbridge  Kent  store I wanted to buy a box of frozen Ham Hocks  usually I can reach them  but found they had been moved to the top shelf of the freezer cabinet.  The freezer cabinet was situated above a freezer which made it even more difficult to reach the item I wanted!  My usual remedy in this situation is to grab the nearest long package I can see and then use it to edge the item I want off the shelf.  But no - you have grown wise to this and I found there is now a 1inch high plastic strip along the edge of the shelf  which means the box of Ham Hocks had to be lifted up over this strip to get them off the shelf!  Is this a ploy to get older people to exercise more I wonder?  If so  you would have been proud of me  I stretched & stretched until I could stretch no more  and managed to get the item I wanted off the shelf!  Sadly  in the process I have torn or pulled muscles in my upper arm and shoulder and have been in agony ever since!  I have mentioned/complained about the positioning of some items before.  Both on-line and in store.  The in store explanation was that all store layouts are designed by computer.  I would like to point out that computers don t actually go shopping - so how would they know the best place to put an item for a human to buy it?  No  all computer programmes do is to show you the best way to cram as much as you can into your stores!  About time the person who designs the computer programmes stopped and thought a bit and realised that not all customers are young  fit and 6 feet tall!  I know you will tell me that I should go and find a  colleague  if I can t access something.  Well I resent this!  Yes - I am verging on elderly but I am fit and able (or was until last week).  Why should I need to add time to my weekly shop running back & forth to ask someone to get things of the shelves for me?  You may assume I am not happy - and you would be right!  So back to my original question:  Why do you issue your staff with round metal steps to stand on when stacking items on higher shelves  but then expect your customers to be gymnasts if they want to buy said items?
column9: Hi Anne, sorry about all this! You mentioned you were injured because of trying to reach a product. I'd like to pass this on to our Executive team to investigate further for you. Could you PM us your full name and address, contact number and email please? I hope you are feeling OK. I look forward to your response, Sas

column4: ** one amazing Sainsbury s lorry driver** NOTE initial update in comments from me. Thanks all no need to share anymore.  Henry and I broke down on the m5 today about 11.50am it was pouring rain and no where at the side of the road to safety wait as we couldn t get behind the safety barrier. About 10 mins went past Henry and I getting very wet and Henry crying and finally a SAINSBURYS LORRY pulled up on the hard shoulder to check if I was ok. At this point Henry has had a nappy explosion to top all things off  straight through his clothes and into the car seat. Craig Marshall was the lorry driver he cleared his cab and took me and Henry to the lorry so I could change Henry in the dry. He handed Henry up to me and then carefully took him off me so Henry was safe. He even said he would dispose of the poopy clothes and nappy which were in two nappy sacks!! He then helped me move my pram to a safer distance from my car  and finally he waited 45 mins in the pouring rain with Henry and I until a traffic officer arrived and the breakdown truck.  MY HERO who went above and beyond to help me. He works for NFT Bristol and they guy deserves such recognition from his company and Sainsbury s  Thank you Craig for restoring my faith in others and for such a kind act that made such a huge difference to me and my 19 week old baby boy. Henry and I got home at about 6 my car is still poorly though  Please share  I will try to track down the company and will write to Sainsbury s too. Sainsbury s please please reward such a wonderful man who is a wonderful advert for your company
column9: Craig......Knight of the road! He deserves an award!!

Craig Marshall was the lorry driver he cleared his cab and took me and Henry to the lorry so I could change Henry in the dry. He handed Henry up to me and then carefully took him off me so Henry was safe. He even said he would dispose of the poopy clothes and nappy which were in two nappy sacks!! He then helped me move my pram to a safer distance from my car  and finally he waited 45 mins in the pouring rain with Henry and I until a traffic officer arrived and the breakdown truck.  MY HERO who went above and beyond to help me. He works for NFT Bristol and they guy deserves such recognition from his company and Sainsbury s  Thank you Craig for restoring my faith in others and for such a kind act that made such a huge difference to me and my 19 week old baby boy. Henry and I got home at about 6 my car is still poorly though  Please share  I will try to track down the company and will write to Sainsbury s too. Sainsbury s please please reward such a wonderful man who is a wonderful advert for your company
column9: Hi Naomi, please be assured we've passed your wonderful comments onto the relevant team. Thanks so much for taking the time to get in touch with us! Maryclare

column4: Why have Sainsbury s decided to change their own brand cereals so that although previously nut safe they are all  may contains ? This means we can no longer buy any of them. My toddler has a nut allergy yet adores cereal. Our only option is to buy other brands & hope she likes them as much as she did yours. Very disappointed ðŸ˜”
column9: Hi Steven. I don't have a barcode handy as we had run out so I went into store to purchase & they now have nut warnings. My daughters favourite were own brand version of rice crispies but i see frosted flakes, weety hoops etc are also now with warnings. My local stores are Upton, Wirral & Cheshire Oaks.  I know there are other nut free households also complaining directly about this too. Why did Sainsbury's decide to change - I just don't understand as it will mean lots of need to now switch brands. Thanks

column4: Dear Sainsbury s  I m afraid I don t have one of your Nectar cards.  Please can you relieve your checkout staff of their duty to  remind  me EVERY SINGLE BLOODY TIME I spend any money in your outlets  that I might have one? So... if you won t stop your staff asking  please can I have a visible  yet discreet  badge that says:  I DON T HAVE A NECTAR CARD ? column4: Can someone please tell me why all Sainsburys own brand cereal  have new allergen information on? This means our daughter  who has severe life threatening allergies  can no longer be NEAR let alone eat any of your cereals. We have bought from you as historically you have been supportive of the allergen community. We are LOYAL customers who spend millions of pounds a year in your store. When I visited Sainsbury 2 weeks ago to see this for myself I burst into tears in the aisle. I have been to upset to contact you. We are now on our last box of  safe  cereal. I m yet to tell my 8 year old that  NO  Sainsburys don t have any safe cereals for you any more...would the person who made this decision like to contact her and tell her personally.
column9: Winterstoke Rd Ashton Bristol. We have only bought your own sainsburys cereals for the last 7 years. These being, cornflakes, Frostie flakes, choco pops, rice pops, multigrain hooplas, boulders and malties.

column4: Hi Sainsburys!  Last Christmas I was searching everywhere for your Whiptop ParvÃ© vegan squirty cream but could not find it anywhere. I live in Hertfordshire and I m willing to travel anywhere to get my hands on it as I am missing out on many a yummy dairy and gluten free pudding if I cannot have it in my fridge for the big day. My local sainsburys were unable to order it in for me and this year I have tried ordering it online as it said it was available... however at the last hurdle it told me it was not available in my area and it made me very sad. I have heard rumours that the illusive cream is at the London Colney store? If so  I will go there on Wednesday and buy as many as I possibly can. column4: I have just got off the phone from your Electrical Helpline to be told that as my Sainsburys brand hand mixer is 5 years old you are not able to supply me with replacement beaters for it (one has broken) So is that to imply that just because I have a broken beater I should have to replace the whole machine? I know that the beaters are pretty much one size fits all as I have borrowed beaters from friends before and they all have fit my mixer. column4: I have to say sainsburys  that your way of treating your customers is a disgrace. The amount of times that we ve ordered our shopping from you  your service has been very shoddy. Yesterday we had to wait nearly th hours for our shopping to be delivered only to find that when  our groceries arrived they were  soiled with egg yolks from the box of eggs where three of them were broken. You could have at least phoned us to let us know that you were running behind with the delivery of our shopping but we had to wait until the end of the hour before the manager phoned  to let us know what was going on.  Why do we keep shopping from you  I don t know  but we will NOT be ordering from you lot again as your products are too expensive  whilst you re happy to take our money and treat us like we re nothing.

column4: I came into Sainsburys stoke today and tried to use my phone to scan my nectar card only to be told that they cannot accept this. This is completely ridiculous as it allows you to use this on the self scan checkouts. I wouldn t of minded if it was a small shop but I spent Â£30 which is a lot to me and I have had my purse stolen so I scanned my husbands card for ease. I know I can get the points added if I bring my husbands card to customer services but if I had time to do this then I would have taken my husband with me in the first case. In this day in age it s bad enough that you do not accept contactless but to refuse to scan a barcode off a phone that s the same as the one on your own card makes no sense!
column9: It makes perfect sense when you consider it's a very easy way for fraudsters to confirm valid nectar account numbers and then plunder the points for themselves.

column4: Was warming back to Sainsbury s following lovely Xmas ad  but just tried to return 3mnth Xbox live subscription which cant be used ( as intended gift recipient already has it) only to be told Sainsbury s don t refund gift cards! - might have been useful to have been told this at the point of purchase as i wouldn t have bought it  but since i was given a gift receipt( generally given so the recipient can return the gift and exchange etc) i had no reason to think it wouldn t be suitable to be returned. Not Impressed.
column9: All I know is when I bought it I was told it was a gift receipt. The main point I am trying to make is that had someone at the till told me the item couldn't be exchanged I wouldn't have bought it. Just to point out this wasn't a gift card which I could understand but a 3 month subscription so why it couldn't just be returned to the shelves for someone else to buy and use I don't know.

column9: Hi Nicky, the card that you bring to the till is not activated and when we activate it, it's activated remotely by the service provider - in this instance Microsoft. As advised these fall under the same category as loadable gift cards and unfortunately cannot be returned once activated. Can you send me over a snap of your receipt and the card you purchased? I'll see what I can do for you. Ryan.

column9: Hi Nicky, not to worry, I'll be able to arrange some points to be added to your Nectar card so you're not out of pocket. I'll also make sure that we address this with the store to prevent anything like this happening again. You can even keep the subscription card as an added bonus from us to apologise! Just send over those details and I'll get that sorted asap for you! Ryan.

column9: Hi Nicky, I'm sorry about this but our policy does not allow us to return or exchange any subscription passes or gift cards. I've also looked into this gift receipt you mentioned and our stores don't actually offer these as we have a standard returns policy. While we can't accept the return, its worthwhile noting that Prepaid Xbox Live Subscription passes can be stacked, so they'll still be able to make use of the gift - it will simply extend their subscription by 3 months. Sas.

column4: I just wanted to say how disappointed I am with your Cannock store customer service. Whilst doing some Christmas food and shopping today I sampled some prose I  walking away with it to continue my shopping. As I did so the rather rude sample assistant yelled at me very loudly from across the store to call me back to give me a dressing down in front of customers. When I suggested a sign would be more appropriate  She abruptly told me (again very loudly) if I d asked her she would of told me I had to stand at the samples stand whilst I drank it. I have now left the store without purchasing any of the Christmas wine we went in to purchase and it s highly unlikely I will be returning.

column4: Hi  we try to avoid plastic packaging when shopping as much as humanly possible (which is extremely difficult in supermarkets) but when we do have to get something in a plastic bag we make sure it is recyclable plastic. At our local Sainsburys store you have recently stopped putting fruit in recyclable plastic and apples are now in that non-recyclable crunchy plastic. Please stop!!!! In 2016 you really should be capable of not using ANY non-recyclable packaging for your food  and it is making it very difficult for customers who are trying to make environmentally responsible choices. Thank you.
column9: The Coldham's Lane one in Cambridge. Thanks. But I do think as well as this being done on a local level, Sainsburys should endeavour to have a national policy on zero use of non-recyclable packaging - especially when there are perfectly good alternatives!

column4: So yesterday I made an order for my food shopping as I was in work yesterday partner works away was due back today. so instead having to take my 2 children shopping thought be easier to order online what a mistake that was !!!!! I received my order confirmation to say complete i don t drive so my  sister in law offer to pick up as have no transport....baring in mind my a lot was 8:30/9:30am This morning to get a call at 8:40 to say there machine service that excepts visa electron doesn t work and my order has gone through ( baring in mind this happened on the 21st October aswell same card ) which u was told that your ID department that time was going to be working on this 2 months later happened Again this isn t right ðŸ‘ŽI am know having to take both children in a taxi and shopping in the Xmas rush when one isn t well either I am fuming this shouldn t happened and people need to be aware that there payment with this card won t go trough and be lefted stuck no food shopping and know hit the rush in town to get food in a filed a complaint which they said give me my Â£18 vouchers back but that isn t going replace my day OF or stress taking to children good shopping having wait 45min taxi back  I think disgusting what Sainsbury s have done were they lefted it returning something I was entilitlled to anyways  please be aware when making home deliver orders

column4: Just had a visit to Sainsburys in Cults Aberdeen. The staff many who have been there for many years from the Kelly of Cults days were all dressed up with Xmas hats etc but no fault of their own there was absolutely no Christmas cheer as they stocked shelves. The clinical experience I have seen since it was taken over is absolutely awful with no atmosphere at all and the complete silence with no background music has killed off a community shop that has very few customers now. Surely Sainsburys could do so much better in this ever growing community.

column4: I love your shopping online service and am a delivery pass holder. liking the option (sometimes) of same day ordering. Really annoying!
column9: The disappointment is the ""wide variety"" never includes online. Even the money off my Christmas shop voucher which came in the post so U'm assuming is part of a targeted xmas campaign is for use in store - and I have booked my online shop in advance as encouraged by email. I have been consistently shopping online for as long as I can remember - i want to say since my 18-year old daughter was a toddler - and vouchers used to be dual - so you could use in store but they always also had an online code. column4: Well this is a turn up for the books! Today I visited Sainsbury s wolverhampton to do my shopping with my disabled mom .to find all the trolleys to the wheelchairs were being used .I spoke to an assistant and asked if they had any more   after having a look they came back to say they re all out !  Then they offered me the assistance of a young  lady named Natalie to push my trolley  assist with packing then to escort me to my car and return my wheelchair and if that wasn t enough gave my mom a big bunch of flowers FREE !   Well Sainsbury s Wolverhampton thank you !  You really went Above and Beyond!!  One very pleased shopper xx

Today I visited Sainsbury s wolverhampton to do my shopping with my disabled mom .to find all the trolleys to the wheelchairs were being used .I spoke to an assistant and asked if they had any more   after having a look they came back to say they re all out !  Then they offered me the assistance of a young  lady named Natalie to push my trolley  assist with packing then to escort me to my car and return my wheelchair and if that wasn t enough gave my mom a big bunch of flowers FREE !   Well Sainsbury s Wolverhampton thank you !  You really went Above and Beyond!!  One very pleased shopper xx

column9: Hi there Carole, we have been in touch with the Duty Manager in the store who has advised us that we do offer bubble wrap for all customers who are buying any glassware or any similar products. You can pick this up from the customer service desk. Hope this helps, Gabby

column4: Why do sainsburys not supply wrapping for glassware and china? How on earth do you expect people to get fragile items home safely?
column9: That is rubbish. We have bought glasses and plates on 4/5 seperate occasions in the last few months. On every occasion we asked for them to be wrapped and were told they do not have anything to wrap them in. I went to customer services and asked why there was no wrapping available and was told that they no longer supply any wrapping. The last purchase was 29th november when again my husband asked and was told that they dont supply wrapping. On one occasion we even took our own bubble wrap because we knew we were going to buy glasses.  We were told on one occasion that customer services sometimes manage to keep wrapping from deliveries to the store to use.

column4: Why do sainsburys not supply wrapping for glassware and china? How on earth do you expect people to get fragile items home safely?
column9: Hi there Carole, I have spoken to the store again who have said they definitely offer this service and would like to know some more information from you. column4: Why do sainsburys not supply wrapping for glassware and china? How on earth do you expect people to get fragile items home safely?
column9: If you read my last comment it has the last date. The time was 1.30. On one occasion i was told to use the clothes I had purchased to wrap china and glasses....again stated in a previous comment. column4: How saddened to come home last night to receive in the post a Â£30 parking fine from Harlow Sainsbury s store! I feel sick - never heard of this most stores like tescos you can park with no problem and I ve parked at other sains in hoddesdon and Hertford and you pay for a ticket that can be redeemed and is free after 8pm!  I broke down on the said date and waited for someone to jump start my car never in my wildest dreams did I expect a store that I sadly have stayed loyal to worked for snd praised   There s no visible signage that you park here and risk being fined really really disgusting what a lovely intro into festive season!

column4: I ordered my first home delivery from sainsbury yesterday only to be telephoned today to advise the driver is poorly and could i please be home to receive my delivery earlier ( 5 hours earlier). After i offered to be home 3 hours earlier i was advised they would check if the other driver was willing to wait for me... im the end i agreed to pick my order up from the Ashton store. Whilst the staff there were brilliant i find it unacceptable to order a delivery and end up picking it up yourself. Never again will i order a delivery.
column9: But surely if a drivers ill thats unfortunate. They cant just get someone else to do it they have to be trained and insured. I would assume they phoned round to see if any drivers not working could come in.

column4: I ordered my first home delivery from sainsbury yesterday only to be telephoned today to advise the driver is poorly and could i please be home to receive my delivery earlier ( 5 hours earlier). After i offered to be home 3 hours earlier i was advised they would check if the other driver was willing to wait for me... im the end i agreed to pick my order up from the Ashton store. Whilst the staff there were brilliant i find it unacceptable to order a delivery and end up picking it up yourself. Never again will i order a delivery.
column9: Hi Nicola! I'm really sorry about that. It's certainly not up to the level of customer service we pride ourselves on! Could you send me your full name, address, contact number and order number? I'd like to look into this for you. Dee

column4: We are very frequent visitors to your Morecambe store. Our eldest daughter LOVES to go to the Sainsburys cafe and look around the store after especially the toy section. She is autistic and Sainsburys is one of the very few places that we can go as a family and relax because she is happy there. Today we went for our usual visit straight to the cafe. I went ahead with out other daughter after we had finished to look at the clothing section and my husband followed with B not long after. She bacame extremely distressed and had her fingers in her ears and fell to the floor and wouldn t move. So the first thing we thought was to get her off the floor put her in the trolley where she lay down with her coat over her head. She was relaxed so we left her. We were then approached by a member of staff who said we weren t allowed to have our child in the front of the trolley because they d had kids who had head injuries after falling from the trolleys. I said she has autism and needed to calm because the music was really loud. You don t usually play music?? To which he laughed and said we do at christmas. I then said why does it have to be so loud? He walked off obviously cheesed off with me talking back to him! I understand health and safety but I m pretty sure it would be my fault if she fell and hurt herself. Your colleague s attitude about my daughter s asd was appalling! He never even offered to turn it down for us. We left promptly without any purchases and wont be returning if/until we know when the music is being toned down or off altogether. Plus I think your staff need training in equality and diversity!!!
column9: Hey Stacy, I'm really sorry about all of this, this is not the experience we expect our customers to have in store. Did you happen to catch the colleague's name? I'm going to have a look into this for you. Cheers thanks. Kez

column4: What a disaster my first experience of clock and collect groceries is proving. Slot from 12-1 today at your Coreys Mill store in Stevenage. I arrived at 1 exactly to find nobody there  just a van in the bay. Wait a few minutes before phoning online orders helpline. They try to contact the store  10 minutes of being on hold the call goes to your survey and then cuts off. By now it s 1:20  no sign of anyone still and I have a crying 11 week old baby needing to be fed. I had to leave! Phone the helpline again once he and the baby had been fed and they ve rearranged collection but I m very disappointed that I wasn t called back after the original call disconnected and now I m stuck having to drive back to the store and attempt the whole debacle again. Really not good enough at all. I ll stick to having it delivered in future

column4: I visited your  Pepperhill  store yesterday morning and chose some lovely party clothes for my daughter under a huge pink banner stating  25% off all TU clothing   took it to the till to pay only to be told the promotion had finished last night and that they must have missed a few in-store banners when taking down the promotion not honoring the discount. Upon speaking to the manager  I was told they did not have to apply the discount as it was a mistake that the signage had been left up. Having worked in retail for many years  I was under the impression that the discount should have been honored as it was displayed. Please could you advise your position?
column9: Thanks Helen! I've popped 2000 points (Â£10) onto your Nectar account, these will be available to spend within the next 72 hours. I hope you can get yourself something nice! I'd also advise removing the comment with your Nectar card details for security. Have a lovely day! Holly

You should not have received this kind of reply at all and I'm very sorry they were parked on the double lines and in front of the disabled parking area. Thank you for letting us know about this. Enjoy the rest of your day, Sas

column4: Have just been told by a Sainsburys telephone operator that my iPad mini is incompatible with Sainsburys online ordering  after over 50 successful orders (many of which via the iPad!)   Order appears to go through successfully right down to the last page saying they don t need your verified by visa extra security for this transaction. Then as you wait in the next day for your order to arrive you suddenly have that sinking feeling  and when you check your emails the confirmation email is not there.   Now order cannot be delivered (or collected) until tomorrow when delivery charge changes from Â£2 to Â£5.   What makes me even more angry is the poor response by Sainsburys to this issue. Today I was told to use a different device (which I don t have) or ring sainsburys every time I want to checkout online.   Last month I tried to order online  again the process went smoothly according to my screen right to checkout  unfortunately my son was rushed to hospital the morning I was due to click and collect. I rang Sainsburys from A&E and after confirming my details apologised for not being able to click and collect. Obviously I wasn t in the clearest of mental states but the operator definitely did not say anything about there being no order to collect! They just agreed to cancel my order as I couldn t commit to a new delivery slot.   Now while I didn t expect my order to magically arrive at my house as I have heard about with other supermarkets in cases of emergency  I did expect a certain level of customer service.   I have been loyal to Sainsburys since well before iPads  nectar points and the arrival of budget competitors  but sadly I feel this is the end of our  special relationship  and I shall be looking elsewhere for my groceries. Easier and cheaper than buying a new device that is  compatible .   I have been assured it is not just my iPad but all of them. I would be interested to hear other people s experiences.   From a very sad ex Sainsburys supporter.   Ps please forgive the Christmas film reference  it IS nearly Christmas! (And sorry I can t delete the mistyping below  appears my device is also incompatible with the Sainsburys Facebook page!!!
column9: Hi Lucy, sorry about that! Is your son okay? Did you get the Ipad? Sometimes when using the mobile and android devices it can affect ordering due to compatibility. Hayley

column4: I just want to say how nice one of your delivery drivers was yesterday. column4: We used Sainsbury Ramsgate home delivery for he first time this week. Order arrived at the time requested on Sunday and after the driver left it became apparent that a large number of items were not delivered as the were supposed to be. I immediately the number on the top of he order explained the problem and was then forced to listen to 10 minutes of god-awful hold music whilst the query was investigated.   At the end of this I was told that there was no manager in to be able to contact the driver and find out what had happened. I don t know why only managers can contact drivers.   I asked when I d be getting my goods and was put back on hold for another 10 minutes.   A the end of this I was told the manager would be back soon and would call me then  or failing that would call me back the next morning.   No call that evening or the next morning so I called and went through the same scenario with the help line again. No record seemingly kept of my previous call despite logging it against my delivery reference number.   I was then told the delivery would now be between 1900 and 2100 the following day (today) but that someone would call the next morning to ensure this was still okay with us.   We received no call today and it s now 21:20 and there s still no sign of the delivery.  Not good enough. I will not be using the service again and shall warn others of the inept service that Sainsbury s provide. Rubbish. Where do I get my refund for all of the undelivered items?
column9: PM sent.
