I will not be using the service again and shall warn others of the inept service that Sainsbury s provide. Rubbish. Where do I get my refund for all of the undelivered items?
column9: They don't deliver on Sundays

column4: We used Sainsbury Ramsgate home delivery for he first time this week. Order arrived at the time requested on Sunday and after the driver left it became apparent that a large number of items were not delivered as the were supposed to be. I immediately the number on the top of he order explained the problem and was then forced to listen to 10 minutes of god-awful hold music whilst the query was investigated.   At the end of this I was told that there was no manager in to be able to contact the driver and find out what had happened. I don t know why only managers can contact drivers.   I asked when I d be getting my goods and was put back on hold for another 10 minutes.   A the end of this I was told the manager would be back soon and would call me then  or failing that would call me back the next morning.   No call that evening or the next morning so I called and went through the same scenario with the help line again. No record seemingly kept of my previous call despite logging it against my delivery reference number.   I was then told the delivery would now be between 1900 and 2100 the following day (today) but that someone would call the next morning to ensure this was still okay with us.   We received no call today and it s now 21:20 and there s still no sign of the delivery.  Not good enough. I will not be using the service again and shall warn others of the inept service that Sainsbury s provide. Rubbish. Where do I get my refund for all of the undelivered items?
column9: Didn't hear back from Leigh again either... The total of 40 minutes on the phone listening to some horrific song (I use the word advisedly) by James Corden has left me knackered and saddened.  I'm going to bed now.

column4: Well Sainsbury s I feel let down.... I have a very active 10 year old son  anything sporty and he does it. If I told him sitting on the roof was a sport he would want to do it. Anyhoo he has been making smoothies at school so asked if we could have then at home. We went to our local Sainsbury s and not only bought fruit for said smoothies but also a smoothie maker (it does help having one ha ha). After a hectic weekend my son asked if I would make him one for home time.  So today I have eagerly unpacked the smoothy maker and washed all the components  all washed dried and ready to go. I peel the banana with anticipation  add a splash of orange juice  now time for the strawberries I peel back the lid of those juicy little gems to find them mouldy  a use by date of 10th Dec and they have gone. I think I m going to have a unhappy boy as a banana and orange juice smoothy isn t exactly what he had in mind

The staff were very helpful today in trying to find out if I could order in what I needed but it seems you no longer deal with the supplier? (Huggies - Pull-ups) Over the last year Head Office have seen fit to either remove lines altogether  or replace them with your own brand products (which are not actually a like for like replacement). I m at the point now where I am going to have to take all my custom elsewhere  as I m having to shop elsewhere for the items I can t get in this store any longer.  I do understand this is one of your smaller branches - but in a rural market town if people can t even buy essentials like nappies....they will just go elsewhere.
column9: Spilsby Lincs and it is Huggies Pull-Ups in a size medium. In particualr the boys ones. I have spoken to the manager and your customer care team in the past about the increasingly dwindling stock in this store and always get the same response which is basically that it is not a main store so they cannot stock as wide a range as others. But the reduction in the baby products aisle is really quite appalling. (I have had to go elsewhere today, giving me an extra 40 miles drive all in. I've stocked up now and won't rely on Sainsbury's any more)

column4: Did an online shop last night for delivery this morning as I d got a lunch party arranged. Delivery arrived and the delivery guy was great. Had the oven on ready to cook the gammon joint... Then saw the use by date was 5/12!!! Called up Customer Services who agreed that it is illegal to sell out of date food-health hazard etc... And offered me a Â£20 voucher to compensate and a refund of the Â£10 spent...  I explained again I had 5 people expecting lunch today and the whole lunch party was now going to have to be exported to a local pub... So I was offered Â£30 voucher...?  Finally after what seemed like an eternity on hold I was told that the Supervisors highest offer is Â£80 in vouchers (including the Â£10 cost of the gammon joint). Email vouchers have been received 1 x Â£50 and 1 x Â£30... Emails make no reference of an apology... And I am feeling TOTALLY deflated that all my planning for this lunch party has now gone out of the window... Family travelling from all parts of the U.K. for a pre Xmas lunch as we won t be together for Xmas  and now we have to go out to eat so it won t be the personal  intimate lunch we had all hoped for... Very disappointed... And didn t expect Sainsburys to let me down...
column9: My point is - This was about having a lunch planned (we won't be together for Xmas) starters prepped, desert home made, exchange of gifts - in a nutshell our family Xmas day today... Which now we have to go out for... Not the same ambiance, not the same ""feeling"" - not the same anything...  It is shocking they can send me food that is not fit for human consumption!!

column4: Pet Insurance Rant! After insuring my dogs with you for a while now I am disappointed with your attitude and your policy for exclusions. I will now be looking for a new insurer that actually has some common sense. I made a claim for gastroenteritis for my 8 year old dog when she had to spend a weekend at the emergency vets. You did pay for the claim for which I am grateful. However  you have since placed an exclusion on her policy for all mouth and oral conditions nothing related to what I claimed for. The reason being that when you got the history from my vet to pay the claim it mentioned that during an annual health check they found discolouration on her teeth and I hadn t told you. This discolouration was on a 8 year old dog. This discolouration was so insignificant that it did not require treatment  has never required treatment and after changing her diet has gone. Today your resolution advisor tried to justify your decision by saying that it would be like my dog being diagnosed as having cancer and if I didn t get it treated or tell you that then if I wanted to claim I wouldn t be covered. How is a passing comment by the vet during a routine check (I never took her to the vets because she had bad teeth) that my dog had discoloured teeth anything like some poor person not telling you their dog had cancer?
column9: Those teeth look amazing for an 8yr old! X

column4: How disorganised is the click and collect service in the amblecote branch !!! Waited in line  for 15 min at the customer service desk to collect my order to be told I d got to use the click and collect tablet. This wasn t working correctly so asked if they could sort it on the till where I was looked at blankly and ushered towards the tablet again. I explained I hadn t got much time and asked how long it would take her reply quite a while as there is only one person organising the desk. I had to abandon my trolley with other items in because I ran out of time and needed to collect my son.  Poor organisation for the run up to Christmas busy period and lost money for sainsburys! I now need to make a further visit to try and collect my order !!

I explained I hadn t got much time and asked how long it would take her reply quite a while as there is only one person organising the desk. I had to abandon my trolley with other items in because I ran out of time and needed to collect my son.  Poor organisation for the run up to Christmas busy period and lost money for sainsburys! I now need to make a further visit to try and collect my order !!

column4: As the Mother Of three boys  I can t begin to tell you how difficult they are to buy clothes for. Especially as the majority of clothing retailers end their range at age 12 or 13 (sounds familiar Sainsburys?) and don t resume it again until men s wear. Most stores are hugely biased towards girls ranges (and women s tbh) but I ve usually found yours to be  slightly  more evenly matched. Plus the colours tend to be brighter rather than the normal greys and blacks. However  this gap in age range is incredibly difficult. Now two of my sons are in age 14 clothing  there is literally NOWHERE that caters for them. Step in  men s XS size at Sainsburys! The tees are excellent  super soft and mostly without tags (perfect for my fussiest guy) and everything is good quality and reasonably priced. HOWEVER  not all the range is produced in XS. All I need to buy for christmas are two cosy dressing gowns  preferably NOT in dark blue  for two teenage boys. I have scoured the Internet and high street  found nothing! Surely a store  SOMEWHERE  must notice the existence of boys? After all  there are more born every year than girls!
column9: Hi Claire, sorry that you are having issues with this! I have had a look and cannot see a gown that is XS! If you PM us your email address I will put in a product request for extra small size to be readily available. Paul

column4: Absolutely furious and hugely disappointed.   We do most of our weekly  shopping in Sainsburys and save our Nectar points for our big Christmas Shop. Just over Â£350 worth at the moment.  We went to Sainsbury s Hornchurch today to place our Christmas order for the special items we wanted. Of the 6 items we wanted only 2 were in stock!! Out of stock were 4 easy carve quails/ Taste the Difference Easy carve pheasant / Taste the Difference Panna Cotta and Christmas Cake cube selection. It is 4th December today and there is supposed to be 11 more days for Customer s to place their orders so how on earth can you be out of stock already? It is totally unacceptable.   There was no point in continuing  with the order and we have now ordered the special items through M&S and Waitrose at extra cost but with no other choice as Sainsbury s have let us down.  A very unhappy Sainsbury customer

column4: Re : Sainsbury s Petrol Station  Kenilworth Road  Balsall Common. My 6 year old daughter has more kindness and compassion (and common sense) than some of your staff. My husband and daughter were waiting to pay at Sainsbury s for their fuel when an elderly gentleman in front of them was extremely stressed and worried as he had gone over on his fuel purchase by 13p and didn t have any other cash or means to pay the extra 13p. The staff were standing their ground and insisting the man (who was apparently quite upset and confused) fill out a form so that they could  peruse payment  from him..... For 13p! So  my 6 year old daughter who had her pocket money with her went and gave the man 20p. Shame on you Sainsbury s! However  on the flip side  it was very reassuring as parents to know that what we are teaching our daughter about kindness and thinking of others clearly means something to her. It s a shame the world we live in does not reflect these values a little more. Merry Christmas!
column9: Thank you. Yes I was pretty speechless when they told me. She's so kind and thoughtful.

column9: That's lovely Adele! I'm so glad you've just posted that, as my friend has just posted this and it's rather upsetting! :-(   Let me regale you with an incident that just happened. I was taking my little dog out just now when at the bottom of my street a feral brat launched its bottle of juice at me. I mean it's plastic and it almost  missed but still. Now, this isn't a kid that lives round here. We might be a council estate in the wrong part of Manchester but the kids have respect instilled into them. So much to the extent that I have a friend staying who has a nice car and the kids who normally play in our road have gone elsewhere so that there's no chance of footballs etc damaging said car. But I digress. This feral brat, from a ""better"" area thought it amusing to launch a litre bottle of juice at me for the crime of my being ""fat"". I'm normally of the ilk that would just walk and pay no heed, or at the worst offer a colourful explanation of what I consider to be the problem with the child, but not today. Today I'm utterly disappointed in myself. I'll be 42 years old in February and do you know what I did? I actually burst into tears. Cried like a little girl. I'm deeply ashamed of that but here's my take on why. It's because of bullying I had for the same issue since I was a child, it's because in over 30 years nothing has changed. NOTHING. Some people still think it's OK to abuse and hurt others for such things as their size, gender, skin colour, sexual orientation, gender identity, oh the list is endless. And that's what our society is teaching folk. That it's OK to harm and hurt because of differences, perceived or actual.  Let me tell you something. It isn't ok. Not one bit. Do I hate the child that threw the juice bottle at me? In the moment it happened, yes I did. But that's a reflex. I feel sorry for the child, they've been taught hatred from an early age by people who were taught the same also by people who were taught the same.  It might be time that someone breaks that cycle, that's all I'm saying.

The staff were standing their ground and insisting the man (who was apparently quite upset and confused) fill out a form so that they could  peruse payment  from him..... For 13p! So  my 6 year old daughter who had her pocket money with her went and gave the man 20p. Shame on you Sainsbury s! However  on the flip side  it was very reassuring as parents to know that what we are teaching our daughter about kindness and thinking of others clearly means something to her. It s a shame the world we live in does not reflect these values a little more. Merry Christmas!
column9: Hi Adele, If a customer is short in money to pay for their fuel, it is protocol for the store to fill out this form. I can however appreciate this was disappointing for you. What time were you in store? I'd like to discuss this with the manager in store. Thanks, Allie

My husband and daughter were waiting to pay at Sainsbury s for their fuel when an elderly gentleman in front of them was extremely stressed and worried as he had gone over on his fuel purchase by 13p and didn t have any other cash or means to pay the extra 13p. The staff were standing their ground and insisting the man (who was apparently quite upset and confused) fill out a form so that they could  peruse payment  from him..... For 13p! So  my 6 year old daughter who had her pocket money with her went and gave the man 20p. Shame on you Sainsbury s! However  on the flip side  it was very reassuring as parents to know that what we are teaching our daughter about kindness and thinking of others clearly means something to her. It s a shame the world we live in does not reflect these values a little more. Merry Christmas!

However  on the flip side  it was very reassuring as parents to know that what we are teaching our daughter about kindness and thinking of others clearly means something to her. It s a shame the world we live in does not reflect these values a little more. Merry Christmas!

column4: Re : Sainsbury s Petrol Station  Kenilworth Road  Balsall Common. My 6 year old daughter has more kindness and compassion (and common sense) than some of your staff. My husband and daughter were waiting to pay at Sainsbury s for their fuel when an elderly gentleman in front of them was extremely stressed and worried as he had gone over on his fuel purchase by 13p and didn t have any other cash or means to pay the extra 13p. The staff were standing their ground and insisting the man (who was apparently quite upset and confused) fill out a form so that they could  peruse payment  from him..... For 13p! So  my 6 year old daughter who had her pocket money with her went and gave the man 20p. Shame on you Sainsbury s! However  on the flip side  it was very reassuring as parents to know that what we are teaching our daughter about kindness and thinking of others clearly means something to her. It s a shame the world we live in does not reflect these values a little more. Merry Christmas!

column4: Please tell me what other than Pork of your meat products are non Halal and Haram and Kosher. Please as well would you send me a products listing that confirms what meats have not been slaughtered in a halal or kosher slaughter house although not Halal. If I don t hear from you by Tuesday I will take my Christmas food shopping elsewhere. If you can tell me that certain meat products whether Halal or Kosher and non branded have been slaughtered in a non halal or kosher slaughter house.  Yours faithfully  Daniel King  Against slaughtering animals by bleeding to death. Wether Halal  Haram  Kosher  or other.
column9: Hi Daniel, all the halal and kosher meats are labeled. If they do not have this label they are not halal or kosher. Hope this helps, have a nice evening. Monica

column9: Is it that simple if you read it properly you will note I have asked can you confirm your meat has not been slaughtered in a Halal slaughter house. Some of the meat in supermarkets may not be halal but the animal is slaughtered the same as halal by cutting the throat and allowing the animal to bleed to death. The fact is to kill the animal this way is cheaper as no electricity to stun the animal. But its barbaric if done the Halal or Kosher way. I know all poultry is killed the same regardless of religious beliefs. But I want to know if the Non halal and kosher is killed by stunning.

column4: My family and I have recently started living a zero waste lifestyle  meaning we strive to buy products without any packaging at all  and if we have to  only buy products in recycleable or compostable packaging. I recently enquired at your Chichester store about buying meat and cheese at the deli counters but taking them home in my own containers in an attempt to minimise the amount of plastic we throw away. The staff were really friendly  understanding and helpful  but said that they couldn t accommodate. I ve had to start shopping at a butchers instead  which is an extra trip with my 3 young children  but they re more than happy to weigh the meat on compostable greaseproof paper and transfer to my containers. Because of this  my weekly spend with you has gone down from Â£60 to just Â£10  and to be honest of finding a lot of your competitors use more eco friendly packaging on the items I still get from the supermarket  so I ve started shopping elsewhere. It s a real shame as I ve always had at great shopping experience at Sainsbury s  but when it comes to minimising waste your company just doesn t deliver :(
column9: I don't see her asking a question. I see her voicing her disappointment at her efforts to be more environmentally friendly. It's a valid point. Good luck to her and her family for trying to make a change!

I placed a large order with you and had it delivered within the time frame specified today. However  we discovered very quickly whilst unpacking that a bottle of stain remover had leaked over pretty much the bulk of the Â£140 shop. I m a new mum to an 11 day old baby and having to wash EVERYTHING and even throw items of food out (fruit) as they were dripping with stain remover was not how I planned on spending my Saturday morning whilst dealing with a crying newborn baby. The items were clearly not packed properly or this would not have happened. In addition to this I also found that there was a bag with glass jars in and the bag had holes in the bottom- again  could have been a disaster to have to clean up a smashed jar of apricot jam or apple sauce if the bag had given up.  I m a loyal customer of yours and this is not what you expect when shopping online. I may re-think where I place my order next time. In between feeding and changing nappies  I don t have time to wash my shopping before putting it away!!
column9: Hi Rosie, I am very sorry about this. Can you PM us your order number, account holders name, postcode and email address please? I can then look into this further for you. Monica

column4: Not sure whom this should be aimed at to be honest. Received my click & collect Tu order today. One of the items was too big so rang customer service. I asked if a smaller size could be located in any of my local stores as could not see it online. The agent appeared most helpful locating 3 of the jumpers at Pontypridd store (he did tell me that the numbers were not a live amount) so he would ring through to the store and check if they had the size I required.  A while later of waiting  the agent came back on the phone and said the store had the size I wanted and would keep it for me behind customer services. Off the phone I came a happy customer. So 2 and a half hours later I make my way to the store  hubby goes in and comes out empty handed to be told that they do not have said jumper behind the counter. Now you have one very disappointed customer.
column9: Hi Rachael, I'm so sorry about this! Does your husband know the name of the colleague that he spoke to? Did my colleague tell you the name of the person who said would put it aside? Sas

column4: Please could you advise me where you stand with regard to your fish which is farmed and which is not. I am writing independently to Sainsburyâ€™s and Tescoâ€™s shortly as I have a serious complaint. Despite being vegetarian for approximately 25 years I kept getting pernicious anaemia. B12 injections were not fixing the problem so I consulted with a nutritionist who advised me to eat fish and chicken.  I started to eat your salmon that is on offer all the time (3 packs for Â£10.00 â€“ both Tescoâ€™s and Sainsburyâ€™s) in 2006. Following a variety of consultations  I was diagnosed with a whole host of parasite infestations including fish flukes. it is totally abhorrent to me how this could have happened. having lived abroad for more than 25 years whilst being vegetarian I have not been exposed to meat  fish or seafood during this period and was oblivious to the concept of fish farms and how fish are loaded with antibiotics and other toxic chemicals/ medicine.  Furthermore  I was misled by your promotional marketing advising that products are  â€œresponsibly sourcedâ€ (stet) which means nothing to me now that I have been infected with fish parasites.  Regrettably I have a whole toxic cocktail of parasite infestations and had to consult with professionals about how to eradicate it. Really the idea of it makes me absolutely nauseous.  Please respond to me forthwith and I will make my case independently by letter to you.

column4: Dear Sainsburys  I reckon we (as a family) spend about Â£6000 per year with you on groceries. To me thats a pretty healthy customer.  From what i understand  all customers are important to you as a business. If this is the case  then why when I book an online grocery delivery for 7pm Friday evening (today) does the delivery guy (from Sydenham Store  London) haul the carry crates out of the back of his van onto the road  smash the tops off a few beer bottles  spray the rest of the groceries with beer then try to deliver them to me? I know this happened as I was standing at the front door as i watched him.  He was then quite rude to me as his manager said NO WE CANNOT RE-DELIVER THIS EVE. I m sure you ll agree this is unacceptable.  The delivery van registration plate was PO16 WJL and my order number is: 54831193 Its not good enough sainsburys.

column4: Dear Sainsburys  I reckon we (as a family) spend about Â£6000 per year with you on groceries. To me thats a pretty healthy customer.  From what i understand  all customers are important to you as a business. If this is the case  then why when I book an online grocery delivery for 7pm Friday evening (today) does the delivery guy (from Sydenham Store  London) haul the carry crates out of the back of his van onto the road  smash the tops off a few beer bottles  spray the rest of the groceries with beer then try to deliver them to me? column4: Sexist Sainsbury s! I checked the Sainsbury s website today for jumpers and found some I like. Rather than risk buying the wrong sizes and having to return them  I searched for the nearest largest store in my area and drove there. I was pleased to see many clothes aisles as I walked in. I walked passed the first  then the second and third and forth and fifth and sixth  until eventually finding menswear. It consisted of half an aisle of clothes  of which many were summer t-shirts being sold off cheaply. This is blatant sexism by Sainsbury s. If you don t want male customers  then fine  I ll take my shopping to Tesco instead. You ve definitely lost my custom.

column4: I have a question on job application. I applied for a job with Sainsbury in Paignton as a delivery driver  and they sent me a text message for a telephone interview. I called them and they asked if I have proof to work in the UK. I said yes  I have my birth certificate  and my driver s license.  They said that I need a birth certificate with my parents names on it  and the driver s license was not proof. A birth certificate  even without my parents name on it is surely proof. It s one that I have used since I got it in 1982 after leaving school  just for job interviews  and it has been enough since then. Also  you can t get a British driver s license without being a British citizen. I have a passport  but it is several years out of date. This is the first time that I have come across something like this  so why is it so strict at Sainsbury s?
column9: These are the people that I spoke to. Wouldn't my National Insurance number prove that I am elligible?

column9: Hey, Stella. Serving our customers wherever and whenever they want is at the heart of what we do. We have been open in selected stores on Boxing Day for the last 6 years and our sales data shows us that more and more people are shopping with us on Boxing Day â€“ last year there were over two million transactions in our stores on Boxing Day alone. Where there is a demand, we will always try to meet this to better serve our customers. Thanks very much for contacting us and I hope you have a nice day. Goldie

column4: So I gave up shopping online with ASDA because of bad service and I m now contemplating about giving up with shopping online with SAINSBURYS. Been waiting for my order to be delivered between 9:30-10:30am today. Still no sign   I have 2 young children age 4 and 6months who have their bits in with that shopping as i m unable to get out and about to do a big shop like I did for today s delivery..  I ve emailed your company  aswell as spoken on a online chat via your website.. However the delivery driver was stuck in traffic this morning? .. It s now nearly 5pm  I have hungry children .. Aswell as now cold children as I ve been unable to get out top the gas up due to not knowing if my delivery would turn up whilst I was out..   I m not normally one to complain about this  however I spend alot of money with Sainsburys! And I m really impressed with the lack of communication or customer care your company has given me today.

column4: Dear Elizabeth Boots UKJust thought I would let you know how under the direction of current Chief Executives and all  Boots is wasting vast amounts of money on packaging of items   thus not being environment friendly in this regard. I ordered several items  off of which would fit with ease within one box. However yesterday received one box which was minus three items. These three  items are very small in size equal to length 4.5 inches wide  1.5 inches  depth 1 inch  taking that into consideration you can understand my concern at having just taken delivery of three boxes each 3 ft long via 2 feet wide and 4 inch deep  each box housing just one of the items above. This is just one client  imagine the waste happening within your establishment right now. Someone needs a shake up with regards to packaging. Disgraceful waste of courier and packaging let alone the time taken for all. Further more to pay for a couple of rather expensive items which had   free gifts  inclusive to find them not received  made a phone call to be told  first come first served basis  Not the case  they  are readily available in all stores  in plentiful. Not amused !
